title: Race Report: Lake Stevens 70.3
author: emma
post_content: The <a href="http://runrocknroll.competitor.com/denver">Denver Rock 'n Roll Marathon</a> is a little over a month away!&nbsp; These next two weeks are the final build phase, culminating with a 21-Mile run.&nbsp; My coaches noted that this is the time to prioritize running and suggested we do whatever is necessary to make sure we get every training run in.&nbsp; It was recommended that we do things like write our work-outs down in our calendar and lay out our running clothes...anything that minimizes the amount of effort it takes to get to the work-out.&nbsp; It reminded me of something <a href="http://www.bobbymcgee.com/">Bobby McGee</a> said during his talk last spring: the athletes that have the most success aren't necessarily the most talented, but they are the most well-organized.<br /><br />So...<br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0idaLlo8r6c/TmbkUfZhTrI/AAAAAAAAAgs/cXR7knjirOs/s1600/Screen+shot+2011-09-06+at+9.02.56+PM.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="134" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0idaLlo8r6c/TmbkUfZhTrI/AAAAAAAAAgs/cXR7knjirOs/s320/Screen+shot+2011-09-06+at+9.02.56+PM.png" width="320" /></a></div><br />I thought laying out my running clothes would be a good idea, too.&nbsp; Every time I go for a run, I either just woke up, or just got home from work and have 5-10 minutes to change and get out the door to meet my group.&nbsp; My coach probably meant lay clothes out each day, but I don't trust myself to remember to keep doing that.&nbsp; Instead, I just gathered together a bunch of complete running outfits and other running gear and tossed them in a laundry basket so I can grab-and-go without having to rifle through drawers or piles of clean laundry.&nbsp; (I've been averaging about 5 minutes a day just looking for two matching socks!&nbsp; Ridiculous!)<br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-a9YpB6OiW28/Tmbk43-BOEI/AAAAAAAAAg0/Vj9q745kMgk/s1600/IMAG0026.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="191" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-a9YpB6OiW28/Tmbk43-BOEI/AAAAAAAAAg0/Vj9q745kMgk/s320/IMAG0026.jpg" width="320" /></a></div><br />I also have some <a href="http://abcnews.go.com/GMA/Recipes/story?id=7039586">Lentil Soup</a> simmering in the Crock-Pot so I'll have some easy healthy meals on hand.&nbsp; Hopefully it turns out well!<br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-2pIMI_QEDv0/Tmbk3Ccy-cI/AAAAAAAAAgw/iXJKEPZUqJ8/s1600/IMAG0025.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="320" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-2pIMI_QEDv0/Tmbk3Ccy-cI/AAAAAAAAAgw/iXJKEPZUqJ8/s320/IMAG0025.jpg" width="191" /></a></div><br /><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-nzw9l0hwDns/TmbnkWY13oI/AAAAAAAAAg4/LHI6Z_MKmE4/s1600/IMAG0027.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="320" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-nzw9l0hwDns/TmbnkWY13oI/AAAAAAAAAg4/LHI6Z_MKmE4/s320/IMAG0027.jpg" width="191" /></a></div><br /><br />Happy Fall!<br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br />

title: Ready to Run!
author: emma
post_content: If I were a savvier myspacer I would have the Dixie Chicks playing in the background...<br /><br />As many of you know, I'm training for <a href="http://www.lamarathon.com/" target="_self">this</a>. (I love the way I say that considering I only have 6 "friends" and I doubt any of them are reading this.)  For the past month or so, however, I've been wondering to myself, "What have you gotten yourself into?!"  In an effort to get the spring back in my step, I devoted part of my <a href="http://blog.myspace.com/www.amazon.com" target="_self">Amazon</a> Christmas gift certificates to purchase <a href="http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1570281823/sr=1-1/qid=1138157014/ref=sr_1_1/103-1392856-5660608?_encoding=UTF8" target="_self">this</a>. (On a random side note, I got two gift certificates, one for $20, one for $30, and after selecting all my purchases, my total with shipping and tax came out to exactly $50.  Cool, huh?)<br /><br />Anyway, the book suggested running without wearing a watch and leaving the headphones at home.  These are two crutches I've been very dependent on!  But, for my shorter week-day run this evening, I decided to try it without music.  I also couldn't find my watch, so I ran without that too.  The results were amazing!  I ran faster, I got annoyed whenever I had to stop for traffic lights, I enjoyed myself much more, and I when I got home I just wanted to keep running.  Rather than running for a set amount of time, and counting down the minutes until I could stop, I just ran to the <a href="http://www.nps.gov/linc/" target="_self">Lincoln Memorial</a> and back home.  That's five-point-six miles according to <a href="http://www.gmap-pedometer.com/" target="_self">G-map Pedometer</a>.  (<a href="http://maps.google.com/" target="_self">Google Maps</a> is the best.  True that!  Double True!) <br /><br />For the first time in awhile, I'm actually looking forward to my long run this Sunday.  16 miles this time!

title: Restaurants - Cafe Escadrille - Italian ( Burlington, MA)
author: Meenakshi
post_content: June 2004 saw me in London for a customer conference. We tried the Blue Elephant Restaurant then...there were a lot of groans of dismay from folks as most people did not seem to enjoy Thai food. I love spicy food so I had no complaints.<br /><br />As I strolled through the restaurant it became obvious that much time and money has been poured into creating the exotic ambiance, which seems to cleverly cater just as much for romantic couples as it does for large upmarket office crowds.<br /><br />I had a cocktail called - Miss Siam which iis basically Coconut flesh, Coconut water, Skyy vanilla, Passion fruit liqueur. It was good.<br /><br />Having studied the extensive menu for ten minutes and still not chosen, the group decided to opt for the Royal Thai Banquet with soup (£39 per person), washed down by a reasonably priced bottle of Pinot Blanc and Merlot. And we were not disappointed by our choice. Starters included the regular mixture of Paper Prawns, Fish Cakes, Dim Sum, Satay and Spring rolls followed by a beautifully spicy Tom Yum soup. However, I would have liked slightly more time to digest the starters so that I could fully appreciate the six main courses; this banquet really is not for those with a small appetite! The Emerald Chicken and Green Curry really stood out for me, as well as the Ped Makaram, tender duck slices with a tamarind sauce. The Fresh Black Pepper Tiger Prawn were tender and delicious but the lamb Massaman was strictly OK.By the time the desserts arrived, I was filled to the brim! However I felt I had had a truly wonderful dining experience, and look forward to my next trip to the Blue Elephant. I know my travel companions from the U.S would beg to differ ;)

title: Restaurants - Gojo - Ethiopian (San Jose,CA)
author: Meenakshi
post_content: Two weeks in Washington DC from Calcutta (now pronounced kolkatta)and I felt I had arrived...I knew which ways the water taps opened, which directions the light switches were turned....and how to work the Microwave and Dishwasher....heck I had even figured out which  Metro Buses to get on to reach GWU...man I was Kool with a capital "K"<br /><br />One of my brother's colleagues at Oracle...let's call her P was having her B'Day and the guys were taking her to "Lebanese Taverna" to celebrate. Now in India...the B'day boy or girl treated the rest of the folks to dinner while in the U.S everyone else did the treating ....hmmm....interesting concept...not too appealing to a poverty stricken student. I went with the flow. Kevin (my brother's roommate) assured me it won't be more that 20 bucks...1000 Rs....enough for a family of four in a village in India to live on....ok..ok...stop converting...you are no longer in India.<br /><br />We sat outside and it was a really pleasant evening...the company was great. We had the Meze (appetizers) Calamari and Shawarma...it was really good...especially the Calamari ( umm...folks at that point in time I had no idea what Calamari was and my only exposure to meat was Chicken,Goat, Fish and umm chicken....).<br /><br />I had the Ouzi which was spicy lamb in a pilaf with a Yogurt Side...doesn't sound appealing but was really good. Lamb is a more chewier version of goat meat....I still prefer goat meat anyday...but this lamb had been marinated in wonderful spices and stewed to perfection.<br /><br />I think if we would have stopped with Meze and the entrees we would have been GOOD...well no we had this friend in the group let me call him "S" who was out to impress the B'Day girl...so the finest bottle of wine was shared...some Lebanese wine (all I remember is it was 50 bucks a bottle)...ok..ok so I am cheap :)<br /><br />The dinner was mellow and the company friendly....a experience to be repeated. Do try Lebanese Taverna..if you in the DC area and in the mood for Middle Eastern Food.

title: It's still legal tender dammit
author: ChemRifle
post_content: Wow. 5 months since I've been here. Quite a bit has changed in the last 5 months, that's for goddamn sure.<br /><br />Well, I've been at work officially for over a year now, and I'm still not insane! While Christmas time was fairly hectic, it certainly was survivable, although unpleasant. I suppose the only thing I learned from it is just how goddamn dumb Christmas really is. There were days where I'd accumulate $6000 in my register alone. That's almost a thousand dollars an hour from customers who shouldn't be spending that much and who I doubt have the money anyway. Thanks to the advent of credit cards, it's never been easier to spend money that you don't have! I mean shit, take that $500 of clothes and instead of feeling happy that you spent your money, give it to a family who would be happy to have it in the first place.<br /><br />money-spending+items doesn't equal happiness. Pretty simple really.<br /><br />Anyway, while I used to hate pretty much everyone at work, I'm on good terms with each and every one of them. This Christmas took out the two main targets for some reason, and as such, work is actually pretty cool now. Aside from the puny amount of shifts I've been getting lately, but that's a symptom of the moarket and not the atmosphere. At least I hope.

author: Tucker Hughes
post_content: Last night was the BS high freshman socail.... it was undoubtably the worst dance ever.... it started out like any other lame dance, everyone just stood around the entrance and bobbed their head to the music... then finally after like 45 mintues people start dancing.. which was ok expect that a lot of people had dates so it wasnt like a malvern dance were u just grabbed random people, which sucked cuase i didnt have a date... and they kept the lights on  the teachers were literally standing in the middle... then all of a sudden the music stops and the dj's lights go out... and our principal ( a nun) comes on over the loudspeaker.... she had literally PULLED THE PLUG ON THE DJ... so she makes everyone in the dance SIT DOWN ON THE DANCEFLOOR... and she goes on this tyrate about inapproite dancing saying we look like dogs humping firehidrents, lol, and that our dancing was literally having sex with clothes on... then threatens us saying that if we dont stop the dancing we would have the sit in the auditorim for the rest of the dance... and she would fire the dj for playing inapproite music!!! so for the rest of the dance they LOCKED ALL THE DOORS to make sure no one left and put on crappy 80's synth pop, nat cole ballads... the dj had nothing but rap music so he kept playing the same crappy music over and over... until a sister gave him a... get this... CHRISTIAN ROCK CD... it was torture... literally... worst dance ever....

title: Lollerskates
author: Gabrielle Vitollo, a.k.a. eepedeep
post_content: ok well i tried to comment this but its way to long... i noticed that a few people flipped over my last post... just felt like addressing it... ok first off chill, i just thought it was interesting to post, but yeah whole piont of the letter is and that arguement in general is not to disapprove god its to prove that u cant take everything in the bible literally. I know relegion is a touchy thing, but my opionin is that people use religion as a means to solve the problems that have with themselves, a self help line really. It's hard to explain without sounding really screwed up, but i beleive in religion becuase i know that its the natural way for a human to cope with the hardships of life and it actually is helpful to me ina a ton of ways, but i dont really beleive in a god. I also beleive the bible is a story, A STORY, not a historal or holy document. Its created to help people, its a source of socail codes and a way to forgive themselves for sins. Unforunatly its also a politicail tool, it was re-written many times before it was finallized into the canan (in the third century... so ha dont call me ignorant about this stuff) and re-intpreted to allow for unchallegned rule of kings, invasions and crusades (yes even iraq in a way, not to mention those crusades started the grudge that led to 9/11 leading to the war in iraq.. its all a big circle), the improtance of men in a household, and the prosecution of gays, blacks and any other religion still seem like a holy document? Even today people use religion to excuse all kinds of things, like bush with the war, take for example "christains for the death penalty", if they called themselves "upper white class citzens with no criminal record or chance of being arrested for the death penalty and against the tax pressure of prison" then it would seem cruel, but if their christian.. then ok, as long as its in the name of christ... U REALLY THIBK CHRIST IS FOR THE DEATH PENALTY?!?! id say he got the short end of that stick in his day!!! I mean read the bible, i think "dont kill" is a pretty clear commandment, or love thine enemies... same for the christains for the war.... how do u miss that?!?! Either way.. back to my orginail piont, religion is a self help line. and should be treated as such... u never hear from the "pyschic phill hotliners for the war" becuase its not a way of life its a way to cope with it...

title: A pic of me
author: Oliver
post_content: Well, I finished fourth but because of the same thing. I started second this time then had an awful start. Further in the back, though, two karts locked wheels, and on went flying. It was the number 66 of Kyle Fittro. His kart started to do back flips through the air after he fell out from the initial contact. He had a scraped wrist but other than that he was fine. When the red flags started flying, the three karts in front of me kept on racing. I decided to slow down since it was a red flag and while that happened some of the more stupid kids decided to pass everyone. It took about ten minutes to get everything figured out. Once we started up again I fell back to third. One lap later I got passed on the straight. There was some kid who kept on trying to pass me on the straight but never could do it. I finished fourth in the heat race. After everyone else finished their heat races it was time for the mains. I had, for once, a great start for my main, still in fourth, but catching up to the guy infront of me. I was much faster than everyone in the infield, but once I got to the straight my engine let me down. After a while they still pulled away and I wasn't in their draft. I could of swore the was the number 61 of Matt Jackson trying to pass me but after the race my dad told me that he was actually pretty far back. I had to settle for fourth, which is still great. It was my fifth straight trophy. I can't wait until next race.

title: 4 hours until we leave..
author: Oliver
post_content: It's 4 hours until we leave. Last race I was the fastest but we didn't have the engine settings right, so this should be interesting. Last race, I started on pole but fell back to fourth (because of the engine settings). We were at practice on Thursday from 1:30 PM to 9:00 PM. The best lap time I could make was a 54.5. I was running 54.0s last race but with new tires. During practice we use old tires. I can't wait!

title: It Moves!
author: The Jackal Diaries
post_content: I felt the baby for the first time on Friday (2/24 18weeks 2days) . I had read some time ago that the baby would move away from a flashlight. I stretched out on the couch and flashed the light on each side of my belly. I could feel a fluttering in my lower tummy. I've felt it before, but just didn't know that it was the baby.<br /><br />Kevin tried to feel it, but I think he pushes too hard. He also thought I was kind of traumatizing the baby.<br /><br />The batteries ran out of the flashlight on Sunday night.

title: fake fake fakity fake fake
author: Miss. Annie Thrope
post_content: Her lips turned up.  And in an instant I felt like I was looking at death itself.  I was staring down impurity, fucking hatred, everything wrong with everything right.  And in an instant I knew, portent it; this was the mortal coil.  Her lips creeped higher and higher up until I heard the ripping of flesh.  My eyes fluttered closed; I didn't want to see, didn't want to know.  I could hear the things that held the skin to the muscle, held the muscle to the bones, veins, tendons, it was all ripping away, curling inside itself. The sound of cloth ripping was too much, I squeezed my eyes together tighter.  Ground the enamel of my teeth away.  Pressure hit my body, a wave of nothing, wind almost.  She was gone.  There wasn't anything left, except the chair in which she sat, pulled out slightly. Tilted just to the left.

title: Reality Show?
author: tempdisplaced
post_content: It's been a weekend of changeable weather - breezy, sending the clouds by at a good clip, breaking them up so the sunshine can actually penetrate for short burts, then packing in with a solid rain shower for a few minutes. And the wind has changed direction, now coming from the North which is nippy, but still allowing the weather to change. Way more fun than watching paint dry...<br />Best of all, the February golds, or whatever they're called, have finally bloomed. Been waiting for days for them to get going, sitting curled up in their pistol shapes with just the hint of yellow coming through the outer green covering. But finally, they've opened their little yellow daffodil heads to say that Life isn't always gray and overcast. Hurray.<br />And an update: a few minutes after originally posting this entry, snow is falling, from the North of course, but giant flakes. Hope the daffs don't mind!

title: Burns Night
author: tempdisplaced
post_content: Happy Fourth of July! One of my favorite holidays. I have immense respect for my country, and especially its Declaration of Independence, which appears able to withstand much turmoil. I also love parades, picnics, warm afternoon walks, barbecues, and evening fireworks. I'm making do over here, particularly on memories of happy Fourths gone past. Hope other Americans can find at least a few things to celebrate about the US today.

title: Updates
author: tempdisplaced
post_content: I like the postal service over here. They are remarkably reliable, and efficent. At least from what I see on the receiving end. In the US, first class mail will take anywhere for 1 to 5 days to arrive at it's destination, and there's a reasonable chance it'll be longer or get lost. So you have to employ a private company for guaranteed overnight delivery at $15.00 or so. Here, first class mail will be delivered the next day, for I think 28p (or maybe $0.50). And I haven't had anything lost yet. I like that.

title: furtherest
author: tempdisplaced
post_content: It's odd to me that clothes dryers are not more standard in England. Britain has a soggy reputation, yet many people have no clothes dryer and resort to hanging their mentionables and unmentionables out on a clothes line. It's only quaint for the first day or so, then it becomes downright inconvenient. In the wintertime with daily rain and little heat to evaporate the damp clothes, we resorted to a dehumidifier and a radiator turned as high as it could go. It still took 2 full days to dry out your clothes with this method. In arid, desert prone california, everyone has a clothes dryer, when it would take only 2 hours to dry out on a line. Weird.

author: بهزاد
post_content: <div dir="rtl"><br />هدف ادبیات<br />ماکسم گورکی<br />مفهوم واقعی زندگی در زیبایی و نیروی تلاش به سوی هدف است و هستی در هر لحظه باید هدفی بس عالی داشته باشد<br /><br />ترجمه: م. ه. شفيعيها<br />چاپ سوم، تهران<br />تيرماه ١٣٥٤<br />٢<br />الكسى ماكسيموويچ پشكوف كه بعدها با نام ماكسيم گوركى شهرتى دنياگير كسب كرد،<br />در سال ١٨٦٨ در نيژنى نووگرود كه بعدها گوركى ناميده شد متولد شد.<br />ى منحوس خود را به او نماياند. به همين دليل مدتى مانع : از همان كودكى فقر چهره<br />ى تحصيل وى گرديد. به عنوان شاگرد كفاش، شاگرد نقاش، كارگر كشتى و ... كار مى : ادامه<br />گذراند. : كرد و زندگى را مى<br />كرد. اشتياقى كه به كتاب پيدا : كار مى « در ميان مردم » زيست و : مى « در ميان مردم » او<br />راند. : كرده بود او را به طرف شناختى سازنده پيش مى<br />فرسا سپرى شد. بعنوان باربر اسكله، : اش در كارهاى طاقت : جوانى او نيز مثل كودكى<br />ى آوازهاى دسته جمعى كار كرد. : نانوا، باغبان، خواننده<br />ى ادبيات سياسى : در مسير تحولات فكرى آن زمان كشورش قرار گرفت و به مطالعه<br />سرود » اى سرشناس شده بود. قبل از تحولات سال ١٩٠٥ : پرداخت. در سال ١٨٩٢ نويسنده<br />را نوشت. « سرود مرغ طوفان » و « شاهين<br />محصول همين دوره « مادر » پس از سركوبى جنبش ١٩٠٥ به خارج سفر كرد. رمان<br />است.<br />ى نويسندگان شوروى شد و واقعگرايى جامعه گرايانه : وى در سال ١٩٣٢ رئيس اتحاديه<br />نيز بعنوان الگويى براى « مادر » ى نگارش به نويسندگان توصيه نمود. رمان : را به عنوان شيوه<br />اين شيوه معرفى شد.<br />* * *<br />كتاب حاضر اولين بار در سال ١٣٢٩ شمسى، توسط انتشارات زوار به چاپ رسيده بود.<br />در اين اواخر نيز از طرف چند تن از ناشران — بى آنكه مترجم كتاب از آن اطلاعى داشته<br />باشد — چاپ و پخش گرديد كه خود جاى گله دارد. اميد است نشر حاضر — كه مترجم<br />گرامى تجديد نظر كاملى در آن به عمل آورده است — تا حدودى موجبات رضايت پويندگان<br />ادبيات راستين را فراهم آورد.<br />ناشر<br />٣<br />ه خود را خوانده بودم، i ... شب بود، كه از محفل دوستان، جايى كه آخرين داستان به چاپ رسيد<br />زيادى كه از آن كرده بودند، هيجان مطبوعى در من ايجاد k بيرون آمده وارد خيابان شدم. بر اثر تعري<br />داشتم و براى نخستين بار در عمرم تا اين حد از نشاط : شده بود. با تأنى در خيابان خلوت گام برمى<br />زندگى سرمست شده بودم.<br />ه باشكوهى i ماه فوريه و شب صافى بود. انبوه ستارگان بر آسمان بى ابر نقش بسته بودند. زمين جام<br />هاى درختان از : دميد. شاخه : اى از آسمان به زمين مى : از برف تازه بر تن كرده بود و سرماى گستاخانه<br />هاى خود نقش و نگار زيبا و بديعى در سر راه من ايجاد كرده بودند. ذرات : ديوارها سركشيده، با سايه<br />اى در هيچ جا : انگيزى داشتند. جنبنده : ه ماه درخشندگى نشاط i كنند : شفاف برف، در نور كبود و نوازش<br />شد. صداى خش خش برف در زير پاهاى من، تنها صدايى بود كه سكوت با شكوه اين شب : ديده نمى<br />زد... : روشن و فراموش نشدنى را برهم مى<br />فكر مى كردم: چقدر خوب است كه انسان در دنيا، در ميانمردم ارج و منزلتى داشته باشد!<br />كرد. : ه درخشان و روشنى را برايم تصوير مى i اين انديشه آيند<br />كرد از پشت سرم شنيده شد: : صداى كسى كه با تأمل صحبت مى<br />— ها، شما چيز خوبى نوشته بوديد، بله، عالى بود!<br />از شنيدن اين صداى غيرمنتظره يكه خورده برگشتم و نگاه كردم.<br />اى كه لباسى تيره بر تن داشت خود را به من رسانيد و پا به پاى من به راه افتاد. : شخص كوتوله<br />كرد. سراپاى : هايش نقش بسته بود و از پايين به بالا به صورت من نگاه مى : لبخند نافذى روى لب<br />ه او با ريش نوك تيزش. تمام اندام تكيده و i ها، چان : ها، گونه : وجودش به طور عجيبى نافذ بود: نگاه<br />صدا و سبك حركت : رفت. طورى بى : هاى عجيبش مثل ميخ توى چشم فرو مى : كوچك او با آن گوشه<br />خواندم او را نديده بودم. : لغزيد. در آنجايى كه داستان خود را مى : كرد كه گويى روى برف مى : مى<br />بديهى است كه از شنيدن صداى او متعجب شده بودم: اين آدم كه بود؟ از كجا پيدا شده بود؟<br />سؤال كردم: شما هم گوش داديد؟<br />بله،لذت هم بردم. : —<br />هاى كوچك سياهش لبخند او را از : كرد. لبهاى نازكى داشت و سبيل : با صداى بمى صحبت مى<br />شد اثر نامطبوعى در من به وجود آورد. : هاى او زايل نمى : پوشانيد. اين لبخند كه از روى لب : نظر نمى<br />احساس كردم كه در پشت آن فكر نيشدار و انتقادآميزى نهفته شده است؛ اما بقدرى سردماغ بودم كه<br />اى از نظرم محو شد و در مقابل صفا : نتوانستم به اين حالت سيماى او توجه كنم. لبخند او مانند سايه<br />رفتم : و روشنى رضايت خاطرى كه به من دست داده بود بسرعت ناپديد گرديد. پهلو به پهلوى او راه مى<br />و منتظر بودم ببينم چه مى گويد. در دل اميدوار بودم كه بر شيرينى و لذت دقايقى كه امشب بر من<br />و تمجيد است، براى اينكه سرنوشت به ندرت از روى مهر به k ه تعري i گذشته است بيفزايد: انسان تشن<br />كند. : او تبسم مى<br />همراه من پرسيد:<br />راستى خوب است كه انسان خود را موجودى استثنايى و برتر از ديگران احساس كند، اينطور<br />نيست؟<br />در سؤال او چيز مخصوصى حس نكردم و شتابزده با او موافقت نمودم.<br />هاى كوچكش را كه انگشتان خميده و لاغرى داشت با حالت عصبى بهم ماليد و خنده : او دست<br />٤<br />نيشدارى كرد: هه، هه،هه!<br />ه او آزرده خاطر شدم. به سردى گفتم: i از خند<br />— شما آدم خيلى خوش برخوردى هستيد!<br />كنان با حركت سر حرف مرا تأييد كرد و گفت: : تبسم<br />خواهم بفهمم و از هر : شود و : توزانه : ه تصويرت موجب شرمسارى كينه i توانى زندگانى را طورى تصوير كنى كه پرد : نمى<br />توانى ضربان نبض زندگى را تسريع : ميل سوزان به ايجاد شكل ديگر هستى را در او پديد آورد... آيا مى<br />توانى مثل ديگران، تو هم نيرويى در او بدمى؟ : كنى، آيا مى<br />كردم. : هاى او فكر مى : اى مكث كرد. من ساكت به حرف : همصحبت عجيب من دقيقه<br />خيلى كم است و k بينم، اما در ميان آنها آدم شري : — من گرداگرد خود مردم عاقل خيلى مى<br />بينم كه انسان هر : آنهايى هم كه هستند روحشان بيمار و رنجور است. معلوم نيست چرا هميشه مى<br />تر است به همان اندازه نيروى او كمتر و بيمارتر و زندگانى او دشوارتر است. :k تر و روحاً شري : قدر پاك<br />در نتيجه جز تنهايى و غم سهم ديگرى ندارد. ولى همانقدر كه غم زندگانى بهتر در او زياد است، به<br />بار او براى اين نيست كه با : همان اندازه قدرتِ ايجادِ آن در او كم است. آيا درماندگى و زندگى رقت<br />هايى كه مشوق روح او است، به موقع به او كمك نشده است؟... : گفته<br />همصحبت عجيب من ادامه داد:<br />دهد برانگيزى؟ ببين : ه نشاط بخشى را كه روح انسان را جلا مى i توانى آن خند : — بعد هم آيا مى<br />خندند، : خندند، با فرومايگى مى : اند، با بغض مى : آخر مردم از ته دل خنديدن را كاملاً فراموش كرده<br />اى كه از ته دل و : ها صداى خنده : كنند، و هرگز در ميان اين خنده : ها خنده مى : لاى اشك : به : اغلب از لا<br />ه سلامتى i شنوى! خوب خنده كردن ماي : ه بزرگسالان را بلرزاند نمى i اى كه سين : حسابى باشد، خنده<br />هi توانى خند : شود. آيا مى : روح است... خنده براى انسان لازم و يكى از امتيازات او بر حيوان شمرده مى<br />كنند، آنهم فقط براى اينكه : ه پستى كه به تو مى i ه شماتت بار، غير از اين خند i ديگرى را سواى اين خند<br />آدم مضحك و قابل ترحمى هستى، در مردم برانگيزى؟ حواست را جمع كن، حق موعظه كردن تنها<br />ه مردم را i شود كه توانايى بيدار كردن احساسات واقعى و صادقان : روى اين اصل كلى به تو داده مى<br />١٢<br />هاى زندگى را خراب كنى، درهم : داشته باشى تا بتوانى به كمك آنها، پتك مانند، بعضى از صورت<br />بريزى و به جاى اين زندگى تنگ و تاريك، زندگى آزادتر ديگرى را ايجاد كنى: خشم، كينه، شرمسارى،<br />توان در دنيا، همه چيز را در هم : هايى هستند كه به مدد آنها مى : آلود اهرم : نفرت و بالاخره يأس بغض<br />توانى آنها را به حركت درآورى؟ زيرا اگر : هايى بسازى؟ مى : توانى چنين اهرم : ريخته نابود ساخت. آيا مى<br />دهى بايد يا به معايب و نقايص آنها نفرتى شديد نشان دهى، و يا به : حق گفتار با مردم را به خود مى<br />خاطر آلام و دردهايشان باطناً عشق عظيمى در خود نسبت به آنها احساس كنى. حالا كه پرتوى از<br />اين احساست به درون تو نتابيده پس فروتن باش و قبل از ايكه حرفى بزنى خيلى بينديش....<br />گرديد. : تر مى : هوا تازه داشت روشن مى شد اما در روح من تاريكى بيش از پيش متراكم و افزون<br />كرد. : ولى اين آدم كه حتى در زواياى روح من هم چيزى برايش نهفته نمانده بود هنوز صحبت مى<br />گرفت: : گاهى اين فكر در من قوت مى<br />آيا او آدم است؟ : —<br />توانستم روى اين معما فكر كنم و از نو كلمات او مثل : اما چون مجذوب گفتار او شده بودم، نمى<br />رفت. : سوزن در مغزم فرو مى<br />ه آن خيلى با تأنى i يابد، ولى رشد و توسع : معهذا زندگانى ما، هم از پهنا و هم از ژرفا توسعه مى : —<br />كند، : گيرد زيرا كه شما قدرت و توانايى تسريع حركت آن را نداريد... زندگانى دامنه پيدا مى : صورت مى<br />آموزند. چه كسى به آنها جواب خواهد داد؟ معلوم است: شما : و روز به روز مردم سؤال كردن را مى<br />كنيد كه بتوانيد : شيادان غاصب عنوان پيشوايى مردم! ولى آيا خود شما مفهوم زندگى را آنقدر درك مى<br />كنيد؟ : فهميد و آينده را پيش بينى مى : براى ديگران آن را روشن سازيد؟ آيا احتياجات زمان خود را مى<br />براى بيدار كردن انسانى كه بر اثر پستى زندگانى فاسد شده، روحاً سقوط كرده است، چه<br />ه او به زندگى خيلى كم شده و ميل به i توانيدبگوييد؟ او دچار انحطاط روحى شده است! علاق : مى<br />شنويد؟ اكنون : خواهد اصلاً مثل خوك زندگى كند، مى : زندگانى شايسته در او رو به اتمام است، مى<br />خندد: زيرا انسان ديگر به صورت مشتى استخوان : كنيد وقيحانه مى : ه آرمان را تلفظ مى i وقتى كه كلم<br />ه زشت ديگر روح او نيست، i درآمده كه از گوشت و پوست كلفتى پوشيده شده است. محرك اين تود<br />وى است. او به مواظبت و تيمار نياز دارد. بجنبيد! تا موقعى كه هنوز انسان k هاى كثي : بلكه هوس<br />توانيد بكنيد، : است كمكش كنيد تا زندگى كند. اما شما براى بيدار كردن عطش زندگانى در او چه مى<br />كشيد، بدون اعتنا چگونگى فاسد شدن او را ترسيم : ناليد، آه مى : كنيد، مى : در حالى كه فقط ندبه مى<br />ها از جبن و فرومايگىآكنده است، سستى : رسد، دل : نماييد؟ بوى پوسيدگى از زندگى به مشام مى : مى<br />هاى نرمى به هم بسته است... شما در اين : ها را با رشته : و تنبلى خردها را از كار بازداشته و دست<br />مقدار و قابل ترحم هستيد! چه : آوريد؟ چقدر شما كوچك و بى : نظمى و هرج و مرج و زبونى چه مى : بى<br />اندازه نظاير شما زياد است! اى كاش يك آدم خشن و دوست داشتنى كه قلب سوزان و مغز توانايى<br />شد كه در اين تنگناى ننگ آور سكوت، : شد كه محيط بر همه چيز بود! چه مى : داشت پيدا مى : مى<br />هاى متحرك : ه اين مرده i وار آنها ارواح تحقير شد : شد و ضربات ناقوس : هاى معجزآسايى شنيده مى : گفته<br />آورد... : مى : را به لرزه در<br />آيد كدام يك در وجود : كردم. يادم نمى : ها مدتى سكوت كرد. من به او نگاه نمى : بعد از اين حرف<br />من بيشتر بود: وحشت يا خجلت؟<br />توانى به من بگويى؟ : ه او شنيده شد: چه مى i سؤال خونسردان<br />١٣<br />جواب دادم: هيچ!<br />و از نو سكوت حكمفرما شد.<br />— پس حالا چطور زندگى خواهى كرد؟<br />دانم. : — نمى<br />چه خواهى گفت؟ : —<br />سكوت كردم.<br />تر از سكوت نيست!... : هيچ كارى عاقلانه : —<br />خنديد كه گويى : اش بلند شد. چنان بالذت مى : مكث دردناكى نمود و به دنبال آن صداى خنده<br />هi مدتها است فرصت چنين خنديدن راحت و مطبوعى را پيدا نكرده است. ولى دل من از اين خند<br />گريست. : لعنتى خون مى<br />كنى؟ : معلم زندگانى؟ تويى كه به اين آسانى دست و پايت را گم مى : — هه هه هه! اين تو هستى —<br />هايى مثل تو كه پير به دنيا : كنم حالا فهميدى من كى هستم؟ هه هه هه ... هر كدام از جوان : فكر مى<br />شدند. : باختند و سراسيمه مى : كردند، همينطور مانند تو خود را مى : اند اگر با من سر و كار پيدا مى : آمده<br />فقط آن كسى ممكن است در مقابل وجدان خود نلرزد كه خود را در زره دروغ و وقاحت و بى شرمى<br />پوشانده باشد. توانايى تو به قدرى كم است كه فقط مشتى براى سقوطت كافى ست! حرف بزن!<br />چيزى بگو كه ترا در مقابل من تبرئه كند. آنچه گفتم تكذيب كن، جانت را از چنگال خجلت و درد رها<br />كن! لااقل براى يك دقيقه هم شده قوى باش، به خودت اطمينان داشته باش تا آنچه را كه من به تو<br />ام پس بگيرم و در جلوى تو سر تعظيم فرود بياورم ... قدرت روحى خودت را نشان بده تا به : نسبت داده<br />ام : معلمى تو اعتراف كنم! من احتياج به معلم دارم. چون انسان هستم. زندگى را در تاريكى، گم كرده<br />جويم. راه را به : و راه رستگارى به سوى روشنايى، به طرف حقيقت و زيبايى، به سمت زندگى نوين را مى<br />اعتنايى : من نشان بده! من انسان هستم. به من كينه ورزى كن، بزن، ولى در عوض مرا از اين لجن زار بى<br />خواهم بهتر از آنچه هستم باشم! چكار كنم؟ به من بياموز! : به زندگى بيرون بكش! من مى<br />فكر مى كردم: آيا انجام تقاضايى كه اين مرد به خود حق داده و پيش پاى من نهاده براى من<br />گردد. بايستى راه : شود، تاريكى شك و ترديد بر افكار مردم چيره مى : مقدور است؟ زندگى خاموش مى<br />بينم. نبايد براى خوشبختى كوشش : خروج را پيدا كرد. راه كدام است؟ من فقط يك راه بيشتر نمى<br />كرد. احتياجى به خوشبختى نيست! معناى زندگى در خوشبختى نيست و رضامندى از خود، انسان<br />هاست. مفهوم واقعى زندگى در : را ارضا نمى كند، زيرا بدون شك، مقام انسان خيلى والاتر از اين<br />زيبايى و نيروى تلاش به سوى هدف است و هستى در هر لحظه بايد هدفى بس عالى داشته<br />ه زندگى كه در آن همه چيز تا اين اندازه i باشد. اين امر ممكن است ولى نه در چهارچوب كهنه و فرسود<br />محدود شده و آزادى روح و فكر انسان در تنگنا قرار گرفته است...<br />اى كرد ولى اين بار خيلى آرام، مثل خنديدن كسى كه فكر بر احساسش غلبه كرده : از نو خنده<br />است.<br />اند و تا چه اندازه آثار كمى از خود به يادگار گذارده اند! چرا بايد : — چه مردم زيادى در دنيا بوده<br />اندازه تحريك : فرستيم، زيرا حسادت ما را نسبت به خود بى : اين طور باشد؟ اما ما به گذشته لعنت مى<br />مى كند، زيرا امروزه چنين مردمى كه پس از مرگ خود اثر پرارزشى بجاى گذارند اصلاً وجود ندارند.<br />شود. : رود و به حيوان بدل مى : كند. به خواب مى : رود ... هيچكس هم او را بيدار نمى : انسان به خواب مى<br />١٤<br />براى او تازيانه وبه دنبال ضرباتِ آن نوازش آتشين و با حرارت عشق لازم است. از زدن او بيم نداشته<br />كند، و آن را به عنوان استحقاق : باش. چون اگر تو او را دوست بدارى و بزنى معنى ضربات تو را درك مى<br />پذيرد. وقتى هم كه احساس درد نمود و از خود خجالت كشيد با حرارت نوازشش كن. دوباره جان : مى<br />ها و فساد فكرى خود دچار : گيرد... مردم هنوز طفل هستند با اينكه گاهگاهى ما را از تبهكارى : مى<br />ه روحى نيازمندند... i كنند ولى هميشه به محبت و كوشش دايم و پيگير براى غذاى سالم و تاز : حيرت مى<br />توانى مردم را دوست بدارى؟ : آيا مى<br />با ترديد سؤال او را تكرار كردم:<br />دانم آيا مردم را دوست دارم يا نه! بايد صميمى : — مردم را دوست بدارم؟ راستى خود من هم نمى<br />دانم. كيست كه با خود بگويد: بله من مردم را دوست دارم! انسانى كه دقيقاً به : و صادق بود: نمى<br />ها روى اين سؤال فكر : مدت « دوست دارم » نگرد قبل از اينكه جواب داده بگويد : درون خويش مى<br />ها از ما دور هستند. : دانند كه نزديكان ما فرسنگ : كند. همه مى : مى<br />روم. : فهمم... و مى : اينكه تو حرف بزنى منظورت را مى : اى؟ اهميتى ندارد. بى : تو سكوت كرده : —<br />بآهستگى پرسيدم: به همين زودى. چون آن اندازه كه من براى خودم وحشتناك شده بودم او<br />براى من نبود.<br />هم پيش تو خواهم آمد. منتظر باش. : روم، ولى باز : بله، مى : —<br />و رفت.<br />اى بود و محو شد... : چه جور رفت؟ متوجه نشدم. بسرعت و بدون صدا رفت مثل اينكه سايه<br />كردم و متوجه : من باز هم مدتى روى نيمكت درون باغ نشستم. سرماى بيرون را احساس نمى<br />درخشد. : ها مى : ه درخت i هاى يخ بست : ه آن بگرمى در روى شاخه i نبودم كه خورشيد طلوع كرده و اشع<br />تابيد و تماشاى اين زمين كهنسال : اعتنايى مى : ه روز روشن و خورشيدى كه مانند هميشه با بى i مشاهد<br />زند، برايم شگفت انگيز و : ه خورشيد برق مى i و فرتوتى كه پوشاك برفى در برگرفته بود و در زير اشع<br />جالب شده بود.</div>

title: Third Grade
author: Jack, Jody and Keb-Mo Jessee
post_content: Every kid today knows about the Xbox, PS2, and GameCube.  Mine is no exception he has all three.  Today the dog (Keb-Mo) learned more about these gadgets than he would have liked.  Keb is a 126lb dog that lives inside with us.  He is a big baby, loves everyone and would not hurt a fly, but sometimes I get tied up at work and can not get free to walk him like I should.  He has grown acustomed to controlling his bladder very well, but every so often he does it in the house.  Today I came in early but I got a telephone call.  Keb was doing his get me out to pee dance, but I could not get off of the telephone call.  He left the room, shortly there after I heard a loud explosion type of sound, the dog flew through the air, hit the wall, and let out a blood curling yelp.  As I ran to see what had happened it was very clear.  Since he had to go very badly and I did not take him out he went to the nearist room, my sons, and pee'ed on the TV.  He did it on the side where the air vents are.  Needless to say he shorted out the tv and he got a very big shock.  The dog is alright, eventhough he may be even better potty trained than before.  The TV is fried, and I am sure Wal-Mart will not trade it for a new one.  Oh well no harm just one TV, and Keb Mo got a real leson in electricity.

title: Bobby's Hits
author: Robert
post_content: The key to success is not what you do, it is how you feel about what you are doing. It is possible to take a simple idea and create a huge success. We think people who accomplish this work hard or have others to support them. We believe they are smarter, richer or in some way more endowed than we are. What we cannot see and do not measure is people's attitudes about what they do. Success begins with a positive attitude; it is the most valuable asset we may own. The people at the top did not fall there. They were willing to do whatever it took, taking the ups and the downs, asking for what they really wanted and staying focused until they got it. Success is not bought or inherited. It is a product of what we put out. Success begins with a good feeling about where we are and a positive attitude about where we want to be.

title: I Am Colorblind
author: cindel ann
post_content: HAPPY SINGLE AWARENESS DAY!!!!!!!!!!!<br /><br /><br />hehe...I stole that from Ms. Becker....I think its hilarious and totally true, I am glad that I have grown up alittle and that I didn't have to make Valentines, I have to thank Shane, Deanna, and Mandy for your lovely cards, they made me happy although I didn't really show it, you know when you only get 3 1/2 hours of sleep it sucks.  I really didn't show much of anything today.  I, right now, am listening to sappy non love songs to make myself feel better, or maybe I just need to make myself sleepy, all of a sudden I am really thirsty...*stomps off to get some refreshing beverage* <br /><br />ok now I am back, so today I was totally tired and DK decided that since we were in quartets he wanted us to get up and sing, row by row, to see if we knew our pitches for John the Revelator, thank god, row 1 did ok.  I wasn't really paying attention to the other rows...so...I was daydreaming off in my own little world...sad but true, becuase I was thinking about going to work tomorrow....I absoulutely do not want to go....at all....thats being truthful for the first time ever, all the other times I was just saying it, but I really do not want to...I might cry right now, nothing is going right there, I am so just...not myself...I don't talk, and if I do, its only usually to the cashiers, because everyone treats me different...<br /><br />I still really like this guy at work and I don't know how I am going to talk to him tomorrow, it will be the first time we have worked together in awhile, and I am scared, and shy and I am definitly not going to know what to say.  Some things changed between us, and I grew apart and that makes me sad.  I got hurt, because I was naive and I aim to change that, I am not a stupid young child anymore, and no one is going to push me around and play with my emotions...no work relationships...AT ALL....I don't care who it is, I don't care if they like me, becuase I am moving I don't need to get into a stupid serious relationship...guys are dumb...really they are...<br /><br />I hate Valentines Day....I really do....so yeah going to work tomorrow and closing, not really looking forward to it, becuase I have to work with a whole bunch of guys...that I don't like anymore, well I like some of them as friends...and only that *I have to start saying that to myself, so I can believe it later on*<br /><br />well I really don't need to depress myself any longer and I don't want to bore any of you longer than I have to so, hope you all had a great day carrying around those dumb roses...they will all be dead in a couple of days anyway...mwahahahahahahahah...have I mentioned I hate Valentines Day?

title: only half there
author: cindel ann
post_content: yay I get to go to work tonight...I love working on Tuesdays..it is sooo much fun because I get to work with the guys...I am not looking forward to working on Friday...because of reasons and people..two of them..bah..whatever..so lets get an update going..um last night I went with Kelsey to Fryin Pan..that was fun  we talked and laughed it was good to catch up on things..and she still has mono..hehehe..the day before that Sunday...Coyote called me and wanted me to work so I said sure why not...and went in..until 5...then Kevin came over to my house and we hung out for almost four and a half hours..its fun what you learn about ppl..I think he is one of my best guy friends..I can tell him anything..well almost..so theres and update...Kelsey I missed you on Sunday and I wish you could have been there with us..next time we are just gonna drop by your house and see you....

title: sloth, rollover
author: zlot
post_content: I’d like to say that I serendipitously stumbled upon the <a href="http://elkitabanana.blogspot.com/">girlsloth</a> blog but I didn’t, so I can’t. My adjacent cubicle blog buddy mentioned it when I happened to be standing and slowly surveying the space around me. The first things that leisurely struck me were a couple of interesting parallels – the usage of the same blog template and that we weirdly began blogging at roughly the same time – May 2004. <br /><br />She has slow adventures in her slothutopic <a href="http://slothville.smugmug.com/">slothville</a>, ahhh this all seems so surreal. She called me "boysloth", in response to the slothprint I left on her blog. I’ve never been called that before but it’s cute; and though I thought I was alone in this cruel precarious-to-sloths universe, this new finding has given me hope.<br /><br />To girlsloth: here's wishing you a slow, furry day too; ok, I guess I should come up with my own goodbye greeting.

title: More than Others
author: Caroline
post_content: Simple thoughts for a simple mind. First off it's summer. The trees have grown and are now green as a breath of the summer before everything aged. It's still spring to my family, but spring is perhaps the least favorite of all my seasons. I love how everything comes back, but my impatiance for waiting sometimes gets the best of me. when the trees have grown their buds, and shade can be cast by their leaves, then it's summer. It's only spring when the all the trees are budding. Flowers are always pre-mature in my mind. As the scouts to spring they bring hope that life will come again, but at some point are snowed on. My true memory of summer are the hot days on the lake, sailing in yet another regatta that my father made me do. Sliding my hand through the warm water I watch the path of air and fingers cut through something very much tangable, and yet not even real. At the moment clouds cover the sky, the potentail of rain exsists, but in this dry climate without the smell of ozone there's all but a small chance of rain.

title: The Trajectory of Thought - 26/09/2004
author: Anupam Jain
post_content: Well except that this time there is no one bullying me into anything! Jill knows I can't write under pressure, and I hope I have driven the point sufficiently straightly home by obstinately refusing to add even a single byte of my written voice to this blog, over a period spanning approximately two years, without having felt even the slightest twinge of shame. I have held out against everything ranging from minor threats to major bouts of unconcern, never wavering. But today things change. Starting today I am going to write 500-ish words a day-ish and at the bidding of my own free will.<br /><br />Wow, that's 118 words already till the dot at the end of this line.<br /><br />Today I shall introduce myself, remaining as superficial as possible. No Sir! No soul searching for me! What I write will, I hope, set the pace of things to come.<br /><br />Mahesh was astounded. Mahesh was stunned. Mahesh brandished a Tommy Gun - Ed. Twenty seven shots were fired into the silent night, as four of the five bulky torsos, attached to swaying, knife wielding limbs, making threatening gestures, were neatly chopped into quarts. It was dark and quite. Mahesh was shocked. Mahesh dropped the gun and it fell to the ground making disagreeing noises. Mahesh began to run. It was time for dinner.<br /><br />Dinner begins at half past eight. The house is clean and brightly lit. Soft music is floating in the air. Mahesh is seated at the head of the table. The little kid sits directly opposite him but does not look at Mahesh. He is looking over his right shoulder at a Television screen. There is soup and peas mixed together on the table. The little kid gets up and changes the channel on the television. The bright lights suddenly change character. Dark rock music engulfs the room. The lights dance around the room in rapidly changing hues. There is no peace on earth, even inside of a man’s house. There is a shotgun on the table - Dark, solid and comforting. Mahesh squeezes his arms around the shotgun and it goes off. There is silence once more. The infernal music is still playing.<br /><br />The little kid was stunned. There was blood in his soup and there was blood on the Television screen. He ran out of the room screaming for help. Two strong bulky hands descended on him at the door and the screaming stopped almost immediately. The fifth had found him. Things were never easy for Mahesh. He always had to fight for his life, but he had always won. Mahesh was invincible and things would remain the same today. He grabbed the right hand of the fifth and spun him around. There was no gun, none was needed. He pushed a knee into his guts. Then twisted his right wrist with an extended palm while simultaneously head butting him into the jaw, breaking it. As the fifth fell, he grabbed his neck and rotated it easily, almost effortlessly.

title: 10-15 Nov : 5 day off
author: Arun N
post_content: Here is just that day I was waiting for. No mail, no queries, no enhancements, no pending work… so far. Just 7 days away from completing 1 full year in Infosys makes me as excited as adding one year- every year to my age.<br />This is the right day for me to remember and pen down the beautiful year that just few by leaving behind some scented petals.<br />Memories of year 1:<br />Just a few days of rest after the college life for few and a big leap from a small company for others, the journey into the heaven scented land of Mysore began. There is no better place to start his career than Infosys, to add to it, Mysore Infy. I can still feel the excitement, enthusiasm and bliss everyone had on 15th of March 05. In the vast campus with some big buildings and motherly maintained greenery added to the excitement.<br />Some carried the work experience with them and many were still kids, Infy took the responsibility to bring them all to the same level, 1 year later I feel they were quite successful. A mentor as old in Infy as we were took the reigns of driving the 180 people wagon through 120 days. He had a special charm, the ability to convince people with a ‘no’ added with a naughty smile – Sujith. He did more than what we expected to make the journey smooth.<br /><br />The days of the college were back: books, tests, exams, results, library, and night-outs. The josh for people to study picked up as compre-started nearing. Tests were minor hiccups which impacted more in the beginning but were restricted only to book-bugs later on.<br />It would be a crime on not to mention on how the days were spent in the luxurious hostel. Rs.50/day for it was not even sufficient for the daily smile of the care-taker of the rooms.<br />Waking up at 7, switching on the TV on full volume, barging into the bathroom to freshen up, calling up Akhi, Shreyas, karthik too meet for breakfast, fighting for which row to sit in the class, cribbing on the same old menu, planning for an outing, coming back into the room, switching on the AC in full power – having a feel of the Arctic’s, calling all the numbers in the telephone book, planning on which channel to watch, joining in again for dinner, lazy walk back to the hostel from the café, snehanshu’s love stories, chat with Arko, Kanta, Bajpai, Siju, Anirudh, Narahari late in the nights sometimes on the rooftop and striking the bed thinking about the new friends you made. Well did I ever mention studies? Oh ya… that to was sometimes cramped into the daily fun-itinerary. Smoking restriction in the rooms brought out some fun filled days between Kanta and Ashwarya. I still cannot forget some wonderful moments spent on the stair-case of the hostels along with some entertainment stunts from Arijith. Cannot even forget the enjoyable trouble Ramesh n Anand gave with their particular ‘requirements’. There are many I have missed out but be sure I haven’t forgotten any, not even the afghan dress of Priya or the string slippers of deepika for which I pulled their legs like crazy.<br /><br />Other than the resort err. Infy campus the time spent in Chamundi Hills, eating Mallige Idli’s, wiling away time in the go-carting tracks, the travel from the remote infy campus to the city, ride on bikes, going in big groups- how they race through my mind leaving the trace of smile on my face.<br /><br />4 months in Mysore, the trip back home was one of the most cherished moments. The games we enjoyed in train with colleagues trying to out beat each other, the best of dumb-charades from Deepika, sleepy Soumya & Shreyas, chirpy Priya n Chaitra, noisy Nidhi, silent but witty Akhi, the politically ‘wrong’ Kanta, the amazing technical discussions with Shaz n Karthik, the great drives in my car and of course ‘one’ most memorable turn, man I miss them a lot.<br /><br />Finally came the compre, the results brought shock n surprise to many, including me. I had no hopes to clear it. But the result was such that it found me wanting just 2 marks more to hit the ‘A’ mark.  But I was through, like many more… that’s what most of them wanted anyway.<br /><br />The value of the time spent in Mysore was mainly felt when we were all parting ways to give back on what was spent on us by Infy. Tears rolled with the feeling that we might not see the people again with whom we spent the best parts of our lives. Messenger and mails would keep us together… even this faded out as the year went by.<br /><br />Training was over; finally, I was happy to be back in Bangalore with parents and friends. EISA it was, the department I would report to. The excitement to work there was short lived. I was desperate to change and fortunately moved over to the Banking domain. A fresher like me was graciously absorbed into the team. Raghu and Shwetha took pains to impart the procedures followed here, and of course taught the ever so confusing Directory structure of Finacle and complex vi editor. Then the usual monotonous work started, enhancing the tools and supporting them became a usual routine. Good work comes regularly but is short lived. Excitement in life now is just a bigger pay cheque and fatter perks.<br /><br />It was a wonderful journey. Passed though one of the most wonderful stations with probably the best people.

title: Week 3
author: Barney Fife
post_content: For some reason I am in a great mood. I think it has to do with my diet. I feel better and thinner. Today I looked at myself in the mirror and thought that my face looked thinner. Probably not, but if felt like it. My pants seem to be getting looser every day. I know this wont last. At some point I will hit a wall, but for now I am enjoying it! I went to Outback for lunch today and I am EXTREMELY proud of myself. I hardly ate any sour cream (and no butter). They also have a very tasty fat free tomato dressing. I am bringing home 3 ounces of dead cow. I think this is the first time I have actually stopped eating before all the food on my plate was gone. My tummy feels full.

title: Week 2
author: Barney Fife
post_content: For the last couple of days I have been waking up feeling better than usual. I don’t seem to have all the aches and pains in my body that I usually suffer from.  I can only attribute that to a change in my diet.  I have limited my fat intake and I think that is making me feel better.  Also, since my stomach is not stuffed when I go to bed, I think I have actually been sleeping better. I have made good choices all this week and for that I am happy. Last Sunday, I think I mentioned that I had a food meltdown – an all you can eat buffet brunch and a high fat dinner. But I don’t think one day is going to ruin my week. I think I will still end up loosing some weight this week if I continue to make good choices. I did indulge today and have meatloaf with mashed potatoes for lunch, but I used some of my flex points so I think it will all work out.

title: Week 1
author: Barney Fife
post_content: I have got the munchies big time!  I went to the grocery store and bought a bunch of Smart Ones frozen foods.  I just had an ice cream sandwich and now I am going to go make some popcorn.  God I am hungry.  I need to drink more water.

title: Motorcycle Helmet Standards
author: Travis
post_content: It seems a Z1000 owner named Ben decided to install a BSD-based PC in the tail of his bike with the goal of providing the infrastructure for some really cool add-ons to the bike. Right now he's got a video camera mounted on board that streams its video to the PC for storage, but his future plans to integrate a GPS that will feed coordinate data to the PC and to connect in an Apple iPod sound really cool.

title: Scooter Sales Growing Faster Than Motorcycle Sales
author: Travis
post_content: Triumph USA reports that their May sales rose 104% compared to May 2003. I'm really glad to hear that the US consumer is starting to realize that Triumph builds great bikes. It seems the introduction of the Thruxton and Rocket III are creating decent consumer demand. Now Triumph just needs to figure out their sportbike strategy. Word is they are discontinuing the Sprint RS and I've heard rumors that the Daytona 600 may be getting some engine upgrades in the 2005-2006 timeframe. I predict that demand for both the Thruxton and the Rocket III will continue to grow through the summer as more and more of the Triumph faithful get a chance to test ride the new bikes at the upcoming RAT raids.

title: Ride Report: Taking the High Road to Taos from Santa Fe
author: Travis
post_content: Christina Shook is a photographer and rider that lives in the Bay Area in California and recently had many of her photographs published in <A HREF="http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/0806525193/motorcycleblo-20" TARGET="new">Sasha Mullin's new book, Bikerlady</A>. Christina also runs her own site, <A HREF="http://www.christinashook.com/" TARGET="new">http://www.christinashook.com/</A> where you can and should check out her amazing photographs of women riders and their rides. Apparently, Shook will have her own book coming out soon titled Chicks on Bikes. So, take a look at her site and if you like her work be sure to keep a look out for her upcoming book release.

title: New York Times Reports on the Pocketbike Craze
author: Travis
post_content: Suzuki announces a "new" line of cruisers for 2005 called the Boulevard collection and the Motorcycle.com MOrons thoroughly debunk the announcement pointing out that they've done nothing more than re-label their pre-existing line of cruisers.

title: Vintage Motorcycle Show at Brian's HD in Langhorne, PA
author: Travis
post_content: In case you missed it in the May issue of Cycle World, here is a link to <A HREF="http://www.mayphotoanddesign.com/" TARGET="new">Keith May's incredible story</A> of his trip from California to Georgia. The pictures he took along the way are a can't miss.

title: Great motorcycle touring suggestions
author: Travis
post_content: Ever since Harley announced the new for 2004 rubber mounted Sporties, almost everyone who owned a Sportster started considering selling, trading or upgrading their ride. For those of you who can't bear to part with your beloved Sportster 883, take a look at this great site that describes one man's progress upgrading his bike to a 1200. He posts a parts list, tools you'll need and tons of pictures of the bike throughout the process.

title: Best Looking Stock Metric Cruiser
author: Travis
post_content: Looks like Norton Motorsports is currently taking deposits from buyers who are willing to pony up $15-20K for either the standard 952 Commando or the special edition Kenny Dreer bike. While longtime Norton aficionados and collectors are likely to snap these up, the bike is not engineered to compete head to head on either or price or performance with any other.

title: Discovery Airs a New Motorcycle Special Tonight
author: Travis
post_content: Looks like Ducati may be all over the news this week. First, the announcement of the street <A HREF="http://www.motorcyclenews.com/news/detail?sectionID=50677&documentID=199468" TARGET="new">Desmosedici RR</A> and now Bostrom and Ducati pull out a surprise win at Pikes, Ducati's first win in Superbike since 2000.

title: RC Sets a New Benchmark in the AMA record books
author: Travis
post_content: According to <A HREF="http://www.motorcyclistonline.com/newsandupdates/pricesrise/index.html" TARGET="new">Motorcyclist</A> alot of manufacturers are planning substantial price increases for 2005 models due to a variety of factors. So, it might be worth it to step up to the plate now and make any new bike purchases you've been considering. As if any of us need an excuse to buy a new bike.

title: Motorcycle USA reviews the Triumph Rocket III
author: Travis
post_content: SpeedTV airs the French MotoGP race at noon EST and the AMA Superbike race at Barber Motorsports at 4:30pm EST. Don't miss the MotoGP race and what will surely be yet another stunning battle between Biaggi and Rossi.

title: mi segundo post en la vida..
author: Kementeus Xtian
post_content: Veamos a ver si ahora si me pongo las pilas y por lo menos escribo algo en el transcurso del año...<br /><br />Tengo como dos años de tener este blog y solo publique un post en mi historia creo, es triste pero esas mañas de estar escribiendo para que la gente sepa que estoy haciendo como que no me agrada mucho, mejor creo que escribire contando un par de locuras que se me han ocurrido durante el 2005, entre esas un par de cositas para que la gente interesada en aprender un poquito cada dia sobre ese maravilloso mundo de investigar las entrañas de la compu y similares sean satisfechas.<br /><br />Creo que el ansia de escribir algo de nuestra vida o lo que decimos o pensamos es inherente en el ser humano, desde los mayas o egipcions al escribir en sus monolitos y papiros las cosas cotidianas o los acontecimientos que ocurren hasta el tiempo actual donde la manera mas común es el abrir un blog. O sea, cuantas veces no he descubierto algo que me ha llevado mi buen tiempo y no he escrito nada? es como negarle a otros el privilegio de aprender de los errores de otros; hasta he pensado que podría ser una forma de autodesahogo, ahora ya con tantos comentarios y noticias realmente estúpidas que suelo leer a diario en internet pues.<br /><br />Veamos cuanto me demora la fiebre bloggera, creo que ya estoy algo viejo para esto...

title: .....SOOO DIM!
author: DEWPAW
post_content: Staying awake is another of my many problems---I've had sleep apnea for several years and I get the great displeasure of wearing a mask that is hooked to a machine which forces air into my system---it's filtered air but you couldn't tell by the fart attacks I have in the mornings! I get so much air into my system I think I'd float away if I didn't weigh so damn much. The mask seems to help every-other-day and I can't recall the last time I had two good nights of sleep in a row---but then, I can't remember anything from a few minutes ago so that's a moot statement.<br /><br />The pressure is on for getting prepared for the trip south---of course nothing is accomplished on the <span style="font-style: italic;">Honey Do  </span>list yet it grows daily.

title: ....BARELY ANY LIGHT!
author: DEWPAW
post_content: It's been nearly a month since my last musing and I've been hard at work with little time for blogging---alas, there's been a break in the highly romantic life of erecting fences and guardrails---I managed to get home earlier today. So far it has been nothing but work sleep eat and do it again---of course, with my wife having a broken leg my life has changed dramatically---if the boys at work could see me now! Washing not only my own clothes (something unheard of) but also my brides, making breakfast lunch and dinner and absolutely the most despicable of all---shopping for groceries! I've also made an alarming discovery---my boobs are getting bigger and I find myself sitting on the pot to pee! I'm thinking of joining a sewing club. When I catch myself staring at guys butts I'm going to divorce the wife and join a nunnery!

title: .....DIMMER!
author: DEWPAW
post_content: This is my first post---or did you guess that from the title? In this experimental attempt to empty my mind on a blogging format I find that there really isn't much of a mind to empty! I work seasonally here in Alaska which usually gets me 5 months out of the year drawing unemployment and sitting in my little computer room surfing. Tomorrow is my first day of work for the new season and I guess I started this blogging experience a little late---since I'm not going to be able to spend quality time on my masterpiece---now my wife (with her broken leg) is calling----gotta' go

title: Wake Up, Neo
author: Kinch
post_content: Sorry bout that -- kicked it all off then left it to rust in the summer sun like a '74 Duster.<br /><br />But thus is summer, and this summer in particular...a season of distractions to be sure. Sadly the July 4th weekend is well endeth, and the grind resumes on the morrow. Between pending work projects and packing for my impending move to a new residence, I expect the rest of July to evaporate forthwith in a puff of smoke.<br /><br />Tonight, however, I await an atypical pounding from a Midwestern thunderstorm, which is surging towards us in Doppler shades of deep green and yellow, as if we are Isengard and the Ents are falling upon us with great vengence and furious anger.<br /><br />I hope to pick up on a redrafting of a short story this evening...a story I've allowed to lie far too dormant after a round of feedback from friends/family. We'll see how it goes.<br /><br />In the meantime, some recent viewings/observations:<br /><br />1) <strong>Farenheit 9/11</strong>: Saw the film in a relatively packed theater today -- a riveting experience of op-ed film. Having willingly and unwillingly absorbed a considerable amount of buzz about the film's assertions prior to seeing it, and being stolid in my voting choice this fall, I didn't expected to be swayed nor surprised...but I <em>was </em>swayed (in a "cementing what I already believe" way) and surprised (by the emotional impact of the soldiers and their families who appear in the film -- the ones who carry the true in burden in any war where lives are lost). It was a powerful, thought-provoking film, and an essential counterbalance to the overwhelming bullshit of the rightwing nuts in TV/radio broadcasting. Huzzah.<br /><br />2) <strong>Salem's Lot</strong>: Anybody catch the recent TNT cable miniseries? The novel (by Stephen King) is an annual read for me, as I am continually bewitched by its entropic tempo, its ominous sense of predetermined doom for its characters, and above all its merciless humor. Anyways, it's one of my favorite King books, and yet again it's been fucked up in adaptation to the small screen.<br /><br />The best you can say about the 1979 version, starring David Soul and directed by Tobe Hooper (auteur behind the original "Texas Chainsaw Massacre"), is that it at least had James Mason as Straker. and a certain schlocky character to it (although depicting Barlow as Max Schrek's grunting cousin was a tragedy).<br /><br />In this latest remake I most of all resented the excess liberties writer Peter Filardi took in his liberal rearrangement of the characters and their relationships (Susan being estranged from Ben Mears rang particularly false, as did the confrontation with Father Calahan in NY). It had a few bright moments (Rutger Hauer in the dump site, the kids on the school bus), but overall a wasted opportunity.<br /><br />To be clear, I'm not opposed to making necessary cuts and rearrangements to adapt a novel to the visual medium --- Peter Jackson's LOTR being one of many great examples of how to do this correctly. But too much tweaking screws up the momentum of the original narrative. Don't second guess the King. Anyways, I imagine this will be out on DVD sooner or later, but I wouldn't waste my time. Read the book instead.<br /><br />3) <strong>Open Water</strong>: My pick for the sleeper flick to see this fall. Looks like a cross between Blair Witch Project and Jaws. Wow. Trailers are playing before "Farenheit 9/11". Nothing like a little shark action to liven the post-summer blockbuster season.

title: Lets get it started
author: Kelton
post_content: So yeah, feel free to publish any fun gossip, shit-talking, whatever

title: Summer
author: John
post_content: So yeah summer is just going by faster than a speeding bullet.  Couple of days ago, I went out with Kristine to go see Harry Potter.  I have no idea why the hell I went to go see that.  I've never read the books nor I have seen the first two movies.  But it was all good because I was with my Kristine.  So the Monday-Thursday happened(Inside Joke your never gonna guess it).  But yeah I was just confused the whole movie.  But I had a great time with my baby.  Anyways so yeah also my Yiayia had a minor stroke.  It was a pretty scary thing.  Then on Saturday, I went to the V103 Car & Bike Show.  It was so tight.  There were so many nice cars. OMG!  Sad thing is, I had to work at the show and not have too much time to look at the cars in the show.  I sat there and handed out flyers for hours.  There were soooo many people.  Good lord.  Anyways I also went to my uncles to go swimming have a little family get together for another birthday celebration for my sister.  So today was Fathers Day.  I spent a lot of time with my dad.  We went out to eat.  Then we went out to my grandfathers grave.  It was a very sad moment.  I miss him very much.  Then we went to my aunts house to go swim and eat dinner.  It was a very nice day.  So yeah next week is just gonna be great.  The only good thing will be my girlfriend's birthday on Friday.  Cant wait for that.  But lets see....Monday....Orthodontist.....Tuesday......Court for those bastards who put a gun to my head.........Wednesday.......I get to get my Wisdom teeth taken out!.....And the rest of the week......Soreness!

title: Yesterday
author: John
post_content: Well lets see yesterday i thought was gonna be a good day.  Went to school had two tests and thought i did really good on them.  Then we had a cross country meeting after school which was tight it was awesome.  After all that, called Kristine and Taylor and we went to blue gold game.  Then alissa came up and starting talking to us.  I felt like i left her out there.  Then alissa invited us to go to her house. Without asking kristine i said yeah and so we went.  When we got there kristine wasnt very happy.  I asked her what was wrong but she didnt tell me.  Then she told me.  At first i was like what happened that one night, and then i remember.  I said i was sorry and i got sad.  But i didnt do anything.  So that was a mistake.  So then we went outside and everything seemed to be fine.  She left and i thought to myself i hope everything was alright.  Well this morning i was talking to her and stephanie says in the background that she wants to talk to me.  So i start talking to her but i have to go eat.  I come back home and kristine finally gives up and tells me whats wrong.   I feel like the biggest asshole in the world right now.  I feel so bad and sorry.  I wish i did something about it.  I wish i asked her if she wanted to go.  well, there really isnt anything i can do about it.

title: OUTTA HERE!
author: Dan
post_content: OK, let's try this again.<br /><br />In my former guise as "The Jobless Lawyer," I posted pretty regularly for several months. Once gainfully employed again, my blogging slowed to a trickle, then stopped, about two years ago. Who knows whether I'll stick with it - and I don't think anyone particularly cares, anyway - but I enjoyed having a forum in which to bloviate endlessly about subjects of interest to me, and I think I'd like to try it again. So here goes.

title: Just saw Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
author: nicolaepadigone
post_content: See, life is worth living for, at least for a few more years. Just met an awesome girl today while at work. This girl came up to the desk needing to download something onto her computer, but her computer's ethernet wasn't working, so she needed it on a disk. The computers at Brown do not have CD burners, and what she needed was bigger than what could be put on the obsolete floppy disks. The computer center at Brown was closed for the weekend, but luckily for this beautiful young lady, I had my trusty iBook with me, with a CD burner in tow, and was able to help her out. The conversation we had was just awesome. She just kept asking questions, probing-type questions that actually showed interest in me, of all people. I couldn't help but do the same. Ah, finally there is someone out there who seems, at least, to show some interest in me. Who knows what will become of this, as she has said she would stop by later on for visits, but for one day, this young lady has made me feel normal once more.

title: Fly By
author: ter
post_content: Time to update my blog<br /><br />Well, finally, finally. Back to SG. It really feels great to be back. Nothing beats SG. hahah.. Now i kinda appreciate everything here in SG. The traffic, the air, the people, etc.<br /><br />My flight landed on Singapore on Friday evening, instead of night. Thanks to my boss. But i feel like i kinda wasted my weekends. I was simply too tired to do anything. Didn't sleep on Thursday night and almost whole of Friday. That's almost 30 hours. And came back home, slept for more than 14 hours. woot! =P<br /><br />Met the gang @ Zouk. Well, it was my first time @ Zouk =P, after it revamped that is. Somehow it looks the same to me. Maybe only the design is different compared to the previous one. Of course, it feels great to see the guys after 2 months. And Beng, yah lah, it was me who put the ice. Only the 2nd round. hahah =P<br /><br />Had a group picture:<br /><br /><IMG src="http://www.geocities.com/show_ip_interface/webby39.jpg" border=0><br /><br />Similarly, i've wasted my Sunday afternoon. 'Cause i reached home @ almost 5am. Woke up at 5pm, then realised i was supposed to meet yiming, zhihui, jenson. Met them for dinner at Orchard. Unfortunately, i've got "fly-aeroplane" by ming. He's still in his depression period, after his 7-years relationship ended. I can understand his situation.<br /><br />But anyway, had a good dinner with zhihui & jenson. And went borders to chill around.<br /><br />The decorations in Orchard this year... is pretty lousy.<br /><br /><FONT color=white><B>Weekly Overview<br />11/28/2005 - 12/04/2005</B><br />Have you considered that what's going down on Monday may have nothing to do with you? Reflect on the size and style of another person's shoes. And then, on Tuesday and Wednesday, relax into the idea of your smallness in the world -- not as any comment on your influence, but just to enjoy a healthy and productive instance of modesty. Like most emotions, this will pass. Thursday and Friday you're feeling the polar opposite of modest: You are huge. You are Paul Bunyan. The world is a forest and you're going to chop it down. Saturday and Sunday see you acting equally ambitious.</FONT><br /><br />I'm happy to come back home.<br />Or should i say, i sooOOOOOOooOOOO happy to be back! =D<br /><br />More things to come in December.<br />16 days left to the test day<br /><br />ter<br />Out~

title: Final Countdown
author: ter
post_content: Just realised how long I've haven't been updating this blog. Well, almost 2-3 months I guess. Have been pretty busy these days. Simply working, mugging, and also meeting up some of my old friends lately.<br /><br />Well let's see... where shall we start...<br /><br />Alright then, lets begin with New Year's Eve then. Hahah... Man, that's freaking way back. But since my last entry was during the Christmas season, I'll just write something brief on what I've been doing all the while.<br /><br />Yup, if I could recall, I've met Suix and Aw for dinner and clubbing for countdown. Three lonely guys. hahah.. But i would say we'd enjoyed ourselves. Head to KTV soon after the countdown. And we sang all night through. Well, guess who was one of the people we met at Zouk? The funnie man Ong Shuhan. That guy just came back from Australia, having his 3 months long break. Still looked pretty the same to me. He'll be going back there to complete his Masters, for a year more I guess.<br /><br />Hmm... then it was work, and work, and work again... Ah.. Then made Mr. Chu, Nicky, Robin, Brian, and some other 24SA fellow offices for a dinner. Still the same old Army guys, not much changes seen. Well, Robin's gonna leave Singapore for Australia too, to further his studies for 2 good years. Supposingly he was planning to stay locally to further his studies, by the man CO advised him to go abroad. And paid him back the full amount of downpayment that Robin had enrolled for. Crazy. But Mr.Chu and Nicky still was as busy as before. Working and studying part-time... Like me. =( <br /><br />Thereafter I met up with my secondary school friends. It was Poh's birthday, and they were celebrating in Dbl O. Haven't see them for a few months, since the big gathering back in June'04. That was pretty long... But I was so delighted to see them again. Poh, Alan, Kejia, Josephine, Ming, Wanting, Teo, Jack. But I arrived late and left early, as I was too tired to carry on. Is this a sign of aging? hah.<br /><br />Not long after, I reunited again with Poh, Ming, Merf, Teo, Alan, Wanting during the Chinese New Year season. Had a small dinner together, and some entertainment.<br /><br />Then there was Dheresse. Hahah.. so weird. I'd rather call her Wenz. (Pardon me if i write all your names in short forms here). This girl just came back from her holiday in Shanghai, China. Of course, she's working over there. Such a sweet girl, who called me in the early morning the day she arrived in Singapore (I think. haha). Humm.. I could still remember her face when we used to sit side-by-side during our Secondary 1 days. And we were sitting right at the front row! And we used to fool around there. Hahah.. And Ming was sitting right beside us on the right side. Ohh... Such beautiful memories we had... right? I wouldn't forget no matter what. I grew up with these people... Same class for 4 years. No doubt we'd bad memories along the way, but let us forget those bad ones, and leave those sweet ones in our hearts, ya?<br /><br />Alright back to the topic. Had dinner with Wenz, Ming, Teo. Supposingly with Pris and Ying, but both didn't turn out for dinner. Pris must have been dating her boy and forgotten the rest of the world huh? Haha.. kidding. Wenz still looked the same to me, still as lovely, although she kept saying that she had grown chubbier. 4 of us spoke about our lifes lately, what have we been doing lately, blah blah blah. But one important thing that I know is, the feeling is still there. The feeling when we were once in Secondary 1. And I felt extremely comfortable with them. 11 years of friendship. I'm so blessed to have them in part of my life.<br /><br />Then we had a rollin good time during our KTV session. We sang our hearts out, and enjoyed ourselves. Pris also joined us during the middle of it. I was overjoyed to see you guys and girls again.<br /><br />Then it was work, and work, and work again....<br /><br />Let me think again... a few days after that, I met up with my Primary school classmates at East Coast Chalet. Just a few hours short gathering. It was weilian's birthday then, and majority was his own friends. Only a handful of my Primary school friends turned up. Unlike that reunion back into 2003. Junjie, Zhiwei, Kathy, Yongsi, Tonghao, Simon, Huiqing, Yangzhi. We chatted all night long.<br /><br />Hmm... I remembered previously Ming kept pester me and asked me to go for his dance performance. Haha just joking. Told him I was working on that day. But who knows I rushed down to NTU to see him. But unfortunately, the performance ended once I arrived. All the audiences started to walk out of the auditorium. Although I wasn't successful to reach there on time, at least I arrived there to support you right Ming? <br /><br />There were also Wenz, Poh, Merf, Kejia, Alan around. Wenz left early, so the rest of us went for supper in Geylang after that. It was a food marathon, and we went to some famous stores located there. Luckily I didn't have any constipation after that night. Haha..<br /><br />Took leave the next day. Wenz was gonna return back to China. Woke up 5am in the morning. Was pretty exhuasted, but it was worthed it. Ming drove us (Alan, Teo, and me) to the airport, and met up with Wenz at Macdonalds. She was there with her parents. Took lotsa photos too. Haha.. I think I still don't have my clear mind, and my eyes looked so sleepy. But we chatted and laughed along the way. And ultimately, sent her into the departure hall. It was pretty sad to see her leave. Hope to see her soon this end of year when she comes back again, ya?<br /><br />And the day after, it was Alan's turn to leave. Damn, I hate that feeling... Went to the airport again, but this time only with Ming. Chilled with Ming, and later met Alan at the departure hall. His mum was there too. Alan's mum was pretty naggy at times, ever since we'd known her style since Secondary 1. Haha.. Back then it was worse. But her naggy was for Alan's good. We had a small lunch with Alan before he entered the gate. And still.. I don't like that feeling either..<br /><br />And now, after 1-2 weeks of the hectic activities I had, it's all back to normal. I've never regret, because I treated everything, everyone sincerely with my heart. I always tell myself (in Chinese) 离别 是为了再相遇的那一天. And that day wouldn't be too long hopefully.<br /><br />I'm now working hard to fulfill my dream. I'm not gonna give up.<br /><br />-----------------------------------<br /><br />我拼了命去追<br />这一路上有太多是与非<br />错或对我又能问谁<br />只求自己问心后无愧<br /><br />跌跌撞撞也许很狼狈<br />多少次我笑中带着泪<br /><br />i won't give up<br />take my hand<br />因为有你的爱当我的信念<br />梦再远也要追<br />不管前方暗藏着多少危险一定是蓝天<br /><br />-----------------------------------<br /><br /><span style="font-weight:bold;">Now Spinnin :</span> [5566] 永不放弃<br /><span style="font-weight:bold;">Now Feelin :</span> Strong

title: Same old brand new you

Looks nice, bright and cheerful, doesn't it?? Apparently it is deeply subversive...so says the secret police. The stumps could be a "M", the red ball a "D" and the green boundary rope a "C"...which makes MDC...the Movement for Democratic Change, i.e. the main opposition to Mugabe.
