title: Saturday, February 5th.
author: Kisetai
post_content: Even though I haven't felt like writing in my journal for quite a while, I really feel like it right now. I think mostly, because I have a bunch of things I want to talk about. I sort of like the idea of writing a tiny journal entry like how Papa did, about things he'd been thinking about. I miss Daddy very, very much right now. I sort of want to send him an e-mail, too.<br /><br />I think that it's rather neat, how Daddy's and my schedules work right now. Especially Wednesdays, I think that it's neat that Papa has Wednesday off, to be with Ojii-sama, on the day that I have class almost all day long. I think that it works super well that way, and is really convenient for both of us.<br /><br />I feel very amused, because I just tried the "grapples" that I picked out at the store. They were a bit disappointing, though. They smelled super much like grapes, but only tasted a little bit like them, and more like apples instead. I didn't like them particularly much, since I don't like grape very much, but it was super, super interesting to get to try them anyway. I wonder if there is a website about them, too.<br /><br />I still feel very much overwhelmed about Ragnarok Online. I like the idea of playing it with Daddy very, very much, though. I think that it will be really fun to get to be Papa's little acolyte. I hope super much, that we won't spend all of our time together playing it, though. I still want to be able to spend time with Papa on AIM, just chatting and snuggling and doing other fun things, and not just playing RO with him.<br /><br />I really didn't like the argument Papa and I had about it, and Kristi today. I really do dislike the idea of having Kristi know very much about me. I think that one of the reasons I dislike the idea so much, is because of some of the comments she's made about BDSM before. She didn't want Ellie to be named Electra, because she thought that it sounded like a name a dominatrix would have. She also got very upset when one of her friends called her that, before too.<br /><br />I feel really odd about the idea of being a little boy for Papa right now. I feel sort of like I've lost the ability to be a little boy for him anymore, really. I like the idea of it still, though. It really helped that Daddy let me be a little boy with him when I got so upset today. Daddy is right, that being a little boy makes it a whole bunch easier to deal with scary or upsetting things. I want to be a little boy for him more often, though. I want to play games with my Daddy, and to do colorings for him.<br /><br />Class today was a bit more interesting than usual, in that we talked a bit about what the different parts of an argument were, and how to tell if something said was just repeating another point the person made. I really like the idea of picking apart the arguments people make.<br /><br />It was very odd when I needed to go to the bathroom during the break we were given tonight, though. I had to wait, which I think is horribly embarrassing and annoying; a middle aged woman came in after me, and then opened the door back up to check the sign on it. I thought that it was so, so funny that she did that. I wanted to laugh very much, but I think that it's good that I didn't.<br /><br />I've really, really liked that Daddy and I have been more sexual lately. I really love being called Papa's little bitch, whore and slut. I like feeling embarrassed, and blushing so, so brightly. I like how it feels when I blush bright red, usually. I really like thinking about Papa dressing me up in revealing outfits, and having me do embarrassing things for him. I liked it very much, when Daddy called me his little "kitten slut" in the scene we started a bit ago. I love being so, so submissive to Papa sexually so much.

title: Wednesday, February 2nd.
author: Kisetai
post_content: <p class="MsoNormal"><b style="">English 126, section #9732 Course Syllabus</b></p>   <p class="MsoNormal"><u>Texts:</u></p>   <p class="MsoNormal"><span style="">            </span><i style="">Writing Logically, Thinking Critically<o:p></o:p></i></p>   <p class="MsoNormal"><i style=""><span style="">            </span>Fast Food Nation</i></p>   <p class="MsoNormal"><u>Course Objectives:</u></p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.5in;">English 126 is designed to develop critical thinking, reading and writing skills beyond the level expected in English 122. This course will focus on the development of logical reasoning and analysis, and argumentative writing skills. We will do this by studying the arguments and exercises presented in the text <i style="">Writing Logically, Thinking Critically</i>, examining arguments from other sources, and then by writing our own essays based on topics from our book-length work <i style="">Fast Food Nation</i>.</p>   <p class="MsoNormal"><u>Course Requirements</u>:</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.5in;">You are required to turn in <u>all</u> formal writing assignments (four formal essays) and pass the in-class evaluations of your reading of <i style="">Fast Food Nation</i>. Regardless of your overall grade average, you must do these things to pass the course.</p>   <p class="MsoNormal"><u>Course Policies</u>:</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.75in; text-indent: -0.25in;"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span style="">a)<span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal;">      </span></span><!--[endif]--><u>I do not accept late work, especially essays</u>. If for any reason you miss an essay due date, you may turn that essay in for credit only on the Revision Date, <u>May 10<sup>th</sup></u>. On that day you may turn in <u>one</u> revised essay (or make-up essay) for a higher grade. If you turn in a revision then, you must also turn in the earlier graded version and highlight any changes that you’ve made to the improved essay. Missed homework and reading quizzes cannot be made up.</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.75in; text-indent: -0.25in;"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span style="">b)<span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal;">      </span></span><!--[endif]-->If you miss more than two classes, I reserve the right to drop you from the active roster. Please respect others by getting to class on time.</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.75in; text-indent: -0.25in;"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span style="">c)<span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal;">      </span></span><!--[endif]-->All work (including homework) must be typed and double-spaced. If you do not have a computer, the SRVC Computer Lab (Room 203) is available during posted hours.</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.75in; text-indent: -0.25in;"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span style="">d)<span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal;">      </span></span><!--[endif]-->All homework must be turned in at the end of the class period in which it is due.</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.75in; text-indent: -0.25in;"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span style="">e)<span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal;">      </span></span><!--[endif]-->Attach to each formal essay <u>all notes and drafts</u>, everything your pen/pencil has touched since you got the assignment. Staple them onto the back of your essay; I will not accept essays that appear as if they materialized into final form out of thin air.</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.75in; text-indent: -0.25in;"><!--[if !supportLists]--><span style="">f)<span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal;">        </span></span><!--[endif]-->Final Exam attendance is mandatory.</p>   <p class="MsoNormal"><u>Expected Courtesies</u>:</p>   <p class="MsoNormal"><span style="">            </span>Please turn off cell phones and pagers. Don’t eat in this class.</p>   <p class="MsoNormal"><u>Grading</u>:</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.5in;">You will be graded on four formal essays, homework, quizzes, a midterm and a final. (Homework importantly includes reading.) Homework will be posted regularly on the whiteboard with other necessary information.</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.5in;"><b style="">A (90-100%)<o:p></o:p></b></p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.5in;"><b style="">B (80-89%)<o:p></o:p></b></p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.5in;"><b style="">C (70-79%)<o:p></o:p></b></p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.5in;"><b style="">D (60-69%)<o:p></o:p></b></p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.5in;"><b style="">F (below 60%)</b></p>   <p class="MsoNormal"><u>Academic Dishonesty</u>:</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.5in;">Any use of another writer’s <u>words or ideas</u> without crediting the writer is academically dishonest and will result in dismissal from the class. If you’re not sure about plagiarism, ask me.</p>   <p class="MsoNormal"><u>Important SRVC Dates</u>:</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.5in;">January 31 – last day to add/drop a full term course with refund.</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.5in;">February 10 – last day to drop a course without a “W” appearing on transcript.</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.5in;">March 25-April 1 – spring recess</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.5in;">April 29 – last day to drop a full-term course.</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.5in;">May 23-27 – final examinations</p>   <p class="MsoNormal">Instructor’s note:</p>   <p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: 0.5in;">Despite the cold formality of this document, I want you to know how much I’m looking forward to this course and to your success. Please feel comfortable seeking assistance from me as necessary.</p>

title: Retkeilyä ja vuokrakämppiä Nuuksiossa
author: iiram
post_content: Hämmentävällä tavalla silloin tällöin tulee mieleen ajatuksia.<br /><br />Joskus ajatukset ovat jopa siinä määrin pohdintaa herättäviä, että niistä tulee kirjoitetuksi pieni juttu -- vaikkapa tänne blogiin.<br /><br />Ehkä kuitenkin useammin käy niin, että ajatukset eivät jutuiksi saakka ehdi päätyä.<br /><br />Ja joskus jäädään näiden välimaastoon: ajatuksen alun saa kirjatuksi, mutta pidemmälle vietyä ajatusrakennelmaa ei esimerkiksi ajanpuutteen -- tai laiskuuden -- vuoksi saa konkretisoiduksi pieneen juttuun kirjoitetuksi tekstiksi.<br /><br />Tällaisia ajatuksia on viime aikoina tullut useamminkin esiin.<br /><br />Toivoisin voivani ja ehtiväni kirjoittaa vaikkapa internetin hämäräverkkojen ("Darknets", esim. waste) esiinmarssista, jota jotkut pelkäävät ja josta toiset iloitsevat. Toisaalla on jatkumon luominen erilaisista joskus ehkä tahtomattaankin läheisilleen mikrotueksi joutuvan henkilön pienistä elämää ehkä helpottavista verkkopohjaisista apuohjelmista, kuten OpenSSH ja WinVNC sekä näiden kautta käytettävissä olevat etäkoneiden ylläpito-ohjelmat (ks. esim. <a href="http://labmice.techtarget.com/windows2000/Administration/command.htm">Win2000 Command Line Resources</a>).<br /><br />Mutta tässä nämä aiheet muistiinmerkittyinä. Ehkä niistä joskus enemmän. Saatan tulla kirjailemaan näitä "kirjoittamisen arvoisia teemoja" tässä myöhemminkin tälle palstalleni.<br /><br />Jos vaikka joskus aika antaisi myöden niiden työstämiseen.<br /><br />Joskus.

title: Reaaliaikaista F1-seurantaa mobiilisti: IRC-kanava #f1_forum
author: iiram
post_content: <p class="mobile-post">Kun tuossa aiemmin mainitsin löytäneeni www-saitin www.tinyapps.org, jossa on tarjolla vähän levytilaa ja keskusmuistia vaativia ohjelmia, niin tässä nyt sitten oma kompilaationi ohjelmista, joilla voi luoda suhteellisen pienellä muistimäärällä toimivan kokonaisuuden. Ohjelmat, joista näyttää tulevan ihan kohtuullisesti surffaus- ja sähköpostikelpoinen kokonaisuus vieläpä musiikkisoittimella varustettuna, muodostui nyt sitten seuraavasti:</p><p class="mobile-post">Tekstinkäsittely: Abiword (n. 9 MB leytilaa)<br />- perustoiminnallisuus hyvin katettuna<br />- osaa käsitellä Word-tiedostoja</p><p class="mobile-post">Pikaviestiohelma: Miranda (n. 3 MB levytilaa)<br />- osaa kytkeytyä mm. seuraaviin verkkoihin: aim, msn, yahoo, jabber, irc jne.</p><p class="mobile-post">Sähköpostiohjelma: nPOP (n. 300 kb levytilaa)<br />- osaa POP3-protokollan mukaisesti vastaanoton ja smtp-lähetyksen</p><p class="mobile-post">Taulukkolaskenta: Spread32 (n. 1,3 Mb levytilaa)<br />- osaa tuottaa excel97-muotoisia taulukoita</p><p class="mobile-post">Tekstieditori: Win32pad (n. 80 kb levytilaa)<br />- hieman notepadia edistyneempi tekstieditori</p><p class="mobile-post">Mediasoitin: XMplay (n. 370 kb levytilaa)<br />- osaa soittaa mp3:t ja nettiradiot; paljon muutakin</p><p class="mobile-post">Kun kaikki em. ohjelmat ovat samanaikaisesti käynnistettyinä Internet Explorerin kanssa, ne näyttävät vievän keskusmuistia n. 25-30 megaa. Hieman viritellyssä Windows 2000 -ympäristössä 128MB muistia näyttää riittävän kohtuullisen hyvin näiden pyörittämiseen. Task Manager näyttää muistia olevan käytössä kokonaisuudessaan noin 115MB. On kyllä tunnustettava, että tällöin ei ole käytössä jatkuvatoimista virustorjuntaa eikä konekohtaista ohjelmistopohjaista palomuuria. Ne tuohon kyllä nykyaikana vielä tarvittaisiin. Mutta mistäpä löytää tuollaiset softat, jotka vievät vähän muistia ja ovat silti uskottavasti toimivia?</p><p class="mobile-post">Ja kovalevytilaahan kuluu varsin marginaalinen määrä, noin 15 MB, suhteessa nykyisiin levytilan mammuttisyöppöihin. Vanhemmassa koneessa oleva muutaman gigan kovalevy riittää kovinkin hyvin.</p><p class="mobile-post">Nykyaikaiset perusasiat siis onnistuvat hieman vanhemmallakin koneella kohtuullisesti, jos aivan viimeisimpien kilkkeiden käyttö ei ole tärkein asia. Kohtuullisesti kuitenkin tarkoittaa tässä sitä, että käyttäjän on osattava suhteellisen hyvin varsin heterogeeninen ohjelmisto- ja käyttöliittymäympäristö. Voinee olla, että tietokoneista ja ohjelmista vähemmän kiinnostuneelle henkilölle tällainen ei kuitenkaan toimiva ratkaisu ole, joten uuden raudan ja helppokäyttöisesti yhdenmukaisesti toimivaksi kokonaisuudeksi hiottujen pakettien kauppiailla varmaankin riittää markkinaa jatkossakin. Vähämuistinen tietokone vaatineekin käyttäjältä enemmän muistia ja osaamista.</p><p class="mobile-post">Taitaapa kuitenkin olla niin, että yksi tärkeimmistä kaupallisista markkina- ja myyntiargumenteista onkin ehkä hieman yllättäen helppokäyttöisyys ja käytettävyys eikä monipuolinen, mutta kovin heterogeeninen ja käyttäjän näkökulmasta riippeistä koostuva ohjelmien toiminnallisuus. </p><p class="mobile-post">Olisiko tässä jopa uutta liiketoimintasarkaa Linuxin ja Open Souce -ohjelmistojen toimittajille? Saisimmekohan ohjelmisto-ominaisuuksien, tehokkuuden ja avoimuuden ylistyksen kupeeseen myös käyttäjien usein toivoman yksinkertaisen ja yhdenmukaisuuden näkökulman arvostuksen? </p><p class="mobile-post">Saapa nähdä, ken tähän teemaan tarttuu. Tarttuukohan kukaan?</p><p class="mobile-post"></p>

title: Softaa puhelimiin
author: iiram
post_content: <p>Jonkun vuoden takaista propagandaviestiä siteeraten voinee todeta, että maaseutua ei ehkä voi tuoda, mutta alkaapa tuntua siltä, että sitä voi hyvinkin viedä. Pienemmätkin maaseutukunnat ja kyläyhteisöt alkavat näemmä pikkuhiljaa löytää netistä uudenlaista ulottuvuutta, jonka kautta kesäisin kylässä käyvän kaupunkilaisväen voinee tavoittaa myös talven tuimina tuisku-iltoina. </p><p>Ainakin itse olen ollut kovin ilahtunut siitä, että yhä pienemmistä kylistä ja kyläkaupoista alkaa löytyä tietoa ja tunnelmaa myös netin välityksellä. Esimerkkejä näistä löytyy omasta näkökulmastani mm. seuraavista: </p><ul><li><a href="http://www.utulanseutu.net/">utulanseutu.net</a></li><li><a href="http://www.utulankauppa.com/">http://www.utulankauppa.com/</a> </li><li><a href="http://www.ruokolahti.fi/">http://www.ruokolahti.fi/</a></li><br /></ul><p>Arjen ulkopuolella olevat asiat tunkevat arkeen. Onkohan se niinkään huono asia?</p><p> </p>

title: Welcome to Nomadness Ranch
author: Jean and Malcolm Hunter
post_content: Hello to all!!  You are reading the website of Jean and Malcolm Hunter.  We are catching up with the new technology and trying to take advantage of what is out there.  Here are some picutres and tales of adventures happening in our lives on Nomadness Ranch.

title: என் மனவெளியில்!
author: கரிகாலன்
post_content: மட்டக்களப்பு - காத்தான்குடி எல்லைப் பகுதியில் மட்டக்களப்பு மாநகரசபையினால் அமைக்கப்பட்ட வரவேற்பு பெயர்ப்பலகை மை ஊற்றி சேதமாக்கப்பட்டது தொடர்பில் காத்தான்குடியில் உள்ள அதிருப்தியாளர்களுடன் பேச்சுவார்த்தைகளை மேற்கொள்ள தீர்மானிக்கப்பட்டுள்ளது.<br />மட்டக்களப்பு மாநகரசபையில் இன்று வியாழக்கிழமை இடம்பெற்ற கூட்டத்திலேயே இந்த தீர்மானம் மேற்கொள்ளப்பட்டுள்ளது.<br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-4nsS1Fd4mK4/T5HEwk0tqwI/AAAAAAAAAEo/S3ni9bhvWoo/s1600/batti%2Bmc07.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left:1em; margin-right:1em"><img border="0" height="215" width="320" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-4nsS1Fd4mK4/T5HEwk0tqwI/AAAAAAAAAEo/S3ni9bhvWoo/s320/batti%2Bmc07.jpg" /></a></div><br /><br /><br />மட்டக்களப்பு மாநகர முதல்வர் சிவகீதா பிரபாகரன் தலையில் இடம்பெற்ற இந்த கூட்டத்தில் மாநகர ஆணையாளர் சிவநாதன், உதவி முதல்வர் ஜோர்ஜ்பிள்ளை, காத்தான்குடி பள்ளிவாசல்கள் சம்மேளன தலைவரும் மீரா ஜும்மா பள்ளிவாசல் தலைவருமான அல்காஜ் சுபைர், காத்தான்குடி நகரசபை தவிசாளர் எஸ்.எச்.எம்.அஸ்வர், மீரா ஜும்மா பள்ளிவாசல் செயலாளர் ஐ.எல்.சபீர் உட்பட பள்ளிவாசல், மட்டக்களப்பு மாநகரசபை பிரதிநிதிகளும் கலந்துகொண்டனர்.<br /><br /><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"><a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-MY62M5cFgbQ/T5HE7FJI7CI/AAAAAAAAAE0/aCTpEu01-FQ/s1600/batti%2Bmc04.JPG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left:1em; margin-right:1em"><img border="0" height="242" width="320" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-MY62M5cFgbQ/T5HE7FJI7CI/AAAAAAAAAE0/aCTpEu01-FQ/s320/batti%2Bmc04.JPG" /></a></div><br /><br /><br />இதன்போது கடந்த சில மாதங்களுக்கு முன்னரும் மட்டக்களப்பு - காத்தான்குடி எல்லையில் அமைக்கப்பட்டிருந்த வரவேற்பு பெயர்ப்பலகை இனந்தெரியாத விஷமிகளால் அகற்றப்பட்டு அது மீண்டும் அமைக்கப்பட்டிருந்த நிலையில் சில தினங்களுக்கு முன்னர் மீண்டும் அந்த வரவேற்பு பெயர்ப்பலகை மீது கறுப்பு மை ஊற்றப்பட்டுள்ளது.<br /><br />இது தொடர்பில் இந்த கூட்டத்தில் கடும் கண்டனம் தெரிவிக்கப்பட்டதுடன் மீண்டும் அதே இடத்தில் புதிய வரவேற்பு பலகை நிறுவுவதெனவும் அதற்கு காத்தான்குடி நகரசபை மற்றும் காத்தான்குடியின் மக்கள் பிரதிநிதிகளை அழைப்பது எனவும் தீர்மானிக்கப்பட்டது.<br /><br />தமிழ் முஸ்லிம் மக்களுக்கிடையில் மீண்டும் ஒரு பிளவை ஏற்படுத்தும் இவ்வாறான செயல்களை வன்மையாக கண்டிப்பதாக இங்கு கருத்து தெரிவித்த மட்டக்களப்பு மாநகர முதல்வர் சிவகீதா பிரபாகரன், யார் தடுத்தாலும் அவ்விடத்தில் வரவேற்பு பலகை மீண்டும் நிறுவப்படும் என தெரிவித்தார்.<br /><br />இங்கு தொடர்ந்து கருத்து தெரிவித்த அவர்,<br /><br />கடந்த 30 வருடகாலத்தில் இரு சமூகமும் பல்வேறுபட்ட முரண்பாடுகளில் இருந்து விடுபட்டு இன்று ஒரு சிறந்த நிலையினை நோக்கி பயணித்துக்கொண்டிருக்கும் நிலையில் இவ்வாறான செயற்பாடுகள் அதனை சீர்குலைக்கும் நடவடிக்கையாகவே நோக்கவேண்டியுள்ளது.<br /><br />ஒரு சில விசமிகளால் மஞ்சந்தொடுவாய் எல்லையில் மட்டக்களப்பு மாநகரசபையினால் அமைக்கப்பட்டிருந்த “வணக்கம், மட்டக்களப்பு உங்களை வரவேற்கின்றது” என்ற பெயர்ப்பலகை அகற்றப்பட்டிருந்தது. வணக்கம் என்ற வார்த்தை கராம் என்று கூறியே அந்த பெயர்ப்பலகை அகற்றப்பட்டிருந்தது.<br /><br />என்றாலும் பல இஸ்லாமிய சகோதரர்கள் அது குறித்து ஆதங்கப்பட்டனர். அவ்வாறு வணக்கம் என்றும் சொல்லும் வார்த்தை கராம் இல்லை. இது சில விஷமிகளின் விடயமாக உள்ளது. இதனை ஒரு சமூகத்தின் பெரியவர்கள் என்ற வகையில் இதனை அனுமதிக்க முடியாது என்று என்னிடம் தெரிவித்துள்ளனர்.<br /><br />அதன் பின்னர் காத்தான்குடியில் உள்ள பல்வேறு அமைப்பினருடனும் கதைத்து காத்தான்குடி நகரசபைக்கு எழுத்து மூலம் அறிவித்து ஒரு புரிந்துணர்வின் அடிப்படையில் “வணக்கம், மட்டக்களப்பு உங்களை வரவேற்கின்றது” என்ற பெயர்ப்பலகை மீண்டும் நடப்பட்டது.<br /><br />எனினும் மிகவும் மனம் வருந்தத்தக்க வகையில் ஒரு சில தினங்களுக்கு முன்னர் அந்த பெயர்ப்பலகையில் மை ஊற்றப்பட்டு அழிக்கப்பட்டுள்ளதானது மிகவும் வருந்தத்தக்க செயலாகவுள்ளது என்றார்.<br /><br /><br /><br />இது  ஒரூ  செய்தி   இன்னொமொரு<a href="http://www.tamilwin.com/show-RUmqyERUOUhs2.html"> செய்தியை</a> பாருங்கள் .<br /><br />http://www.tamilwin.com/show-RUmqyERUOUhs2.html<br /><br /><br />இரண்டினையும் பற்றி என்ன நினைக்கிறீர்க ள்?<br /><br /><br /><br /><br />

title: நீயா?  நானா?   நடந்தது என்ன?
author: கரிகாலன்
post_content: <a onblur="try {parent.deselectBloggerImageGracefully();} catch(e) {}" href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gyKY8QO_a_U/TrNT8NmXmWI/AAAAAAAAAD4/gadTQPFKYtQ/s1600/suppu.jpg"><img style="display:block; margin:0px auto 10px; text-align:center;cursor:pointer; cursor:hand;width: 320px; height: 140px;" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-gyKY8QO_a_U/TrNT8NmXmWI/AAAAAAAAAD4/gadTQPFKYtQ/s320/suppu.jpg" border="0" alt=""id="BLOGGER_PHOTO_ID_5670968649697433954" /></a><br />எனது இந்த பதிவில் இனி சுப்புஅம்மானும்,சுப்புக்குட்டியும் இடையிடையே<br />சந்தித்து கதைக்க போகிறார்கள்.பல்வேறுபட்ட பல விடையங்களை அவர்கள்<br />கதைப்பார்கள். நகைச்சுவையுடன் அதே நேரம் சிந்திக்க வைக்ககூடியதாகவும்<br />அவர்களின் உரையாடல் இருக்கும்.எண்ணத்தில் உதித்து சில மாதங்களே<br />ஆன , பதிவுலக வரலாற்றில் முதன்முதலாக வலையேறும் சுப்பு அம்மானையும் சுப்புக்குட்டியையும்வரவேற்க நீங்கள் தயாரா? அவர்கள் தயார். சரி ,சரி கைதட்டியது போதும்.<br /><br />தொடர்ந்து பல்வேறு விடையங்களை உங்களுடன் பகிர்ந்து கொள்வார்கள்.அரசியல்,சினிமா,வம்பு தும்பு,நாட்டு நடப்பு இப்படி பல<br /><br />.இதோ சுப்பு அம்மானும் சுப்புக்குட்டியும் இணைந்து கலக்கும்....................................<br />என்ன பெயரை வைக்கலாம் என்பது உங்களிடமே விட்டுவிடுகிறேன்.<br />ஒரு பெயரை முன்மொழியுங்கள்.விரைவினில் சந்திப்பார்கள்.<br /><br />அன்புடன் கரிகாலன்...

title: புதிய இணையத்தள வானொலி!
author: கரிகாலன்
post_content: <span style="font-size:180%;">மூ</span>க்கு உடைபடுவது என்பார்களே அதனை நன்றாகவே அனுபவித்திருப்பார் இலங்கையின் இராணுவபேச்சாளர் பிரிகேடியர் தயா ரத்னாயக்கா<br /><br />கடந்த ஞாயிற்றுக்கிழமைகொழும்பில் இருந்துவெளிவரும் "சண்டே லீடர்" ஆங்கிலப் பத்திரிகை<br />கருணா குழுவினரின் முகாம் ஒன்று வெலிகந்தைப்பகுதியில் இலங்கை இராணுவத்தின் ஒத்துழைப்புடன் இயங்கி வருவதாக  புகைப்பட ஆதாரங்களுடன் செய்தி வெளியிட்டு இருந்தது. அதன் செய்தியாளர் நேரடியாக சென்று பார்த்துஅதனை எழுதியிருந்தார். <br /><br /> இருந்தும் அதனை அடியோடு நிராகரித்தார் இராணுவப் பேச்சாளர். தமது பகுதிகளில் அப்படி ஒரு முகாம் இல்லைஎன பி.பி.சி க்கு கூட தெரிவித்திருந்தார்.அனால் இன்றைய செய்தி என்னவென்றால் எந்தப் பகுதியில் கருணா குழுவினரின் முகாம் இல்லை என்றாரோ அந்தப் பகுதியில் மோதல்கள் இடம்பெற்று அம் முகாமுக்கு பொறுப்பாக இருந்தவர் காயமடைந்து வைத்தியசாலையில் அனுமதிக்கப்பட்டிருக்கிறார்.இதன்பின்னர் என்ன சொல்லப்போகிறார் இராணுவ பேச்சாளர்.?

title: அனானுக்குப் போட்ட தடை அம்மாவின் அம்மா காட்டிய நடைமுறையே!
author: கரிகாலன்
post_content: <p><span style="font-family:arial;color:#000000;">இன்று மதியம் விகடன்,தினமலர் இணயத் தளத்தில் வந்திருக்கும் செய்தி மனதினை என்னவோ செய்கிறது.கும்பகோணத்தில் ஒரு பாடசாலையில் தீப்பிடித்ததில் 85 இளம் துளிர்கள் (5,6 வயது பாலகர்கள்) தீயிலே கருகி மடிந்திருக்கின்றனர்.100 பேர் அளவில் தீக்காயமடைந்திருக்கின்றனர்.&nbsp; பிள்ளைகளை பள்ளிக்கு அனுப்பிவிட்டு மாலை வீடு வருவார் என்று எதிர்பார்த்திருந்த பெற்றோர் மனதில் இடி விழுந்திருக்கிறது.எப்படி இது நடந்தது என்பது இன்னமும் தெரியவரவில்லை. ஆனால் கண்டிப்பாக விதிமுறைகளுக்கு மாறாகவே இப் பள்ளி நடத்தப்பட்டிருக்கவேண்டும். குறிப்பிட்ட தொகை மாணவர்கள் இருக்கும் கட்டடத்தில் குறிப்பிட்ட வெளியேறும் வாசல்கள் ,தீ ஏற்பட்டால் வெளியேறும் அவசரகால வழிகள், போன்றன அமைக்கப்பட்டிருந்ததா என்பது கேள்விக்குறியே? கண்டிப்பாக இப் பள்ளிக்கு விதி முறைகளுக்கு மாறாகவே அனுமதி வழங்கப்பட்டிருப்பது நாலு கல்வி அதிகாரிகள் மீது நடவடிக்கை எடுக்கப்படும் என்பதில் இருந்தே தெரிகிறது. தமிழ் நாட்டில் பள்ளிகள் கல்லூரிகள் நடத்துவது வியாபாரம் அல்லது ஒரு ஒரு தொழில் என்றாகிப்போன நிலையில் சேவையை விட இலாபம் குறியாகிவிட்டநிலையில் இப்படி நிகழ்வுகள் நேர்வது தவிர்க்கவியலாது. எல்லா கல்லூரிகள்,பள்ளிகளில் கண்டிப்பாக இருக்கவேண்டிய விதிமுறைகள், மாணவருக்கான வசதிகள் "பத்திரங்களில்" மட்டுமே இருக்கும். அதிகாரிகளின் வாயினை பணம் அடைக்கும். சில காலங்களிற்கு முன்னர் தான் இதே போல ஒரு சம்பவம் திருச்சி,சிறீரங்கத்தில் நடந்து மணமகன் உட்பட பலர் இறந்தது நடந்தது. இப்போது இச் சம்பவம். இனி போட்டி போட்டுக்கொண்டு அரசியல்வாதிகள் பார்வை இடுவார்கள். பண உதவி செய்வார்கள்.அவர்களுக்கு வோட்டு குறிக்கோள். பத்திரிகைகள் பக்கம் பக்கமாக எழுதித்தள்ளும் அவர்களுக்கு பத்திரிகை விற்பனை குறிக்கோள். இனி கீழ் நிலை அதிகாரிகள் பந்தாடப்படுவார்கள் மேல் நிலை அதிகாரிகளால், குறிக்கோள் குற்றத்தினை யார் தலையிலாவதுபோடவேண்டும் . பண உதவி ஒன்றும் பாதிக்கப்பட்ட பிள்ளைகளின் உயிரினை மீட்டுகொண்டுவரப்போவதில்லை.காயமடைந்த மழலைகளிற்கு சிறந்த சிகிச்சை வசதிகள் அரச வைத்தியசாலைகளில் வழங்கப்படுவதை அரசு உறுதிப்படுத்தவேண்டும்.இப்படி ஒரு சம்பவம் இன்னொரு இடத்தில் நடைபெறாமல் பார்ப்பதே அரசியல்வாதிகளின், அதிகாரிகளின் கடமையாக இருக்கவேண்டும்.அனால் அவர்களுக்கு அது முக்கியமானதாக இருக்காது ஏனெனில் அவர்களின் பிள்ளைகள் படிப்பது இப்படிப்பட்ட பள்ளிகளில் அல்லவே. மொத்ததில் இச் சம்பவம் தமிழ்நாட்டில் இன்னும் இரண்டொரு மாதங்களுக்கு பரபரப்பாக இருக்கும் பின்னர் எல்லோரும் மறந்து விடுவார்கள்.இன்னொரு இப்படியான சம்பவம் நடைபெறும் வரை. உலக அரங்கிலே தமிழகத்திற்கு ஒரு கரும்புள்ளியாக இச் சம்பவம் இருக்கும் என்று கூறலாம். குழந்தைகளின் ஆன்மா சாந்தியடைய இறைவனை பிரார்த்திக்கிறேன்.</span></p>

title: Sometimes Horoscopes are Amusing
author: Brad
post_content: For the first time in weeks I have gone thru the entire day without being sick to my stomach, and without the nagging depression that has been haunting me. I always had doubts about everything in my life, there was always that hidden voice that whispered in my head. I woke up this morning feeling different, feeling focused, and having the drive to take on anything that stepped in my path. In all of my life I have never been 100% sure of what I wanted. I have always second guessed my own decisions. I know without a doubt what I want from my life and I will start working towards getting it, reguardless of how hard that may be. Today is the begining of my new life, and the end of my old excuses. I will accept responsibility for my actions, and the reactions that were caused by them. Today I will move forward, today I will finally grow up, and today I will start working towards my goals and insisting that I achieve them. I will accept my mistakes, forgive myself, and learn from them to better myself. They say "that which does not kill you only makes you stronger" and it took the worst experience of my life to finally open my eyes to the fact that "I really dont like myself". That changes starting today....

title: Thought for the day
author: Brad
post_content: At this point I dont think I could possibly think any less of myself.. for the last 2 weeks I have been pushing and pushing her to realize what we had. I have been beating myself up trying to figure out what I could have done wrong. The whole time sitting here asking myself how she could do this to us if our relationship ever had any meaning to her. I was so busy insisting that I knew best and that everything would be fine if she would just give us another chance. All this time asking how she could do this to us, never realizing she honestly was doing it for us. With one look into her eyes..all of her pain, all of her love, all of her feeling poured out onto me like a faucet. I was convinced that she had given up on us, but that wasnt the case at all. When she hugged me I felt it, the feelings for me that I thought she was trying to through away, all still there. She has been telling me all along that she wasnt turning her back on us, that she wasnt writing us off, that she just needed time to make things right in her head about us. I just couldnt walk away from her, I just couldnt give her what she needed. All of the doubts that filled my mind, all of the time I spent trying to convince myself that she just didnt care anymore, all of the false reasons that I came up with in my own paranoid delusion fell completely flat when I saw the struggle she was going through in her eyes just by seeing me. I have never felt like more of an ass than I did today, I never realized how bad all of this was hurting her, or how hard she was fighting to make it right, and now that I finally do, I have done so much damage on top of the initial problem that I dont know if it can ever be repaired. So now, not only do I get to spend the rest of my life knowing that I lost the greatest thing that has ever touched my life, but I also get to spend that time, knowing that I may never have it back, and without any doubt in my mind, that there is no one to blame but myself. I dont know how she could forgive me, hell, I dont know how I can forgive me. All I can do is say that I fucked up, and Im sorry that I couldnt just listen, all that I needed to know to make things better was right there, and I never saw it. I was so afraid that I was going to lose you that I couldnt open my eyes to what was really going on. I have always been able to handle tuff situations quite well, but unfortunately when it mattered most, my heart wouldnt let me do what my head knew was best, and as a result..  I will probably never know how the dreams we always had of our life together will end. Im on a roll...what can I fuck up next... *sighs*

title: Wishing Aloud
author: Brad
post_content: Time is what she needs... I dont know how long I can handle this, every hour that goes by the dagger drives a bit deeper into my heart. I now know that the worst pain comes from having someone that you love more than anything..and that you know loves you... tell you that they cant be around you. I only hope that she meant the things she said all this time..and that the things that made us so happy together are the same things that bring her back. If anything that she told me in the last 2 and a half years was true, she will be back... its fitting that the same woman that showed me the most incredible love.. the kind you only read about.. is the same woman that showed me the most horrible pain that i could possibly imagine.. the thing that i have feared the most in my life.. having to live it without her...

title: My Apologies
author: andrew m. madonia
post_content: Not sure, but I think it has been three days since last I wrote.  Not much in between.  Worked.  Huge deal!  Visited, along with Kenny, Steve, and Britney, Dan Giambra and his "new pad" at Shippensburg U.  Honoring Kenny's 19th Birthday we drank like madmen.  Giambra drank to excess, then threw up excessively.  Kenny; didn't throw up or cry.  Congrats!  Theer; got silly, but remained in control.  Brit; only woman in the house, and loved every minute of it!  As for myself, I drank a fair and ample amount of beer (ugh...not planned, I promise) and maintained a responsible and mature level of aloofness.  Congrats to me!  There was, however, after Dan was "out cold" in his bedroom, an "I have a larger penis than you" contest.  Britney was the judge.  Lucky her.  The remaining three, Steve, Kenny and I, dropped trow and flounced our mighty manhood about the immediate air.  Kenny lost, making Steve the victor, while I am happily in the middle.  Slept on a table until dawn, then moved to a vacant couch until 8.  Read, or I should say, concluded Sophocles' "The Women of Trachis".  Much better than his AJAX.  Electra remains best.  Yet to read Oedipus, though.  Home by 3.  More reading; Pound this time.  Tough session.  Mind teamed by other thoughts.  No focus.  Feel at least one more detailed hour in me tonight...

title: My WILL cannot be persuaded
author: andrew m. madonia
post_content: Work from 8-noon: dreadful.  Sold a grand total of 5 paint cans, all of which needed to be tinted.  Drove home in syncronization with a crescent rain falling stiff from the rheumy sky.  Memorial Day picnic cancelled: more time to read now.  Friends arriving at 4-4:30.  Glutting bigtime at the Davall's; possibly a foosball tournament at the Spair's when night falls.  At some point I will be standing atop a bench in the nearby park reciting selected poems by Whitman, as well as one of my own.  Rain continues to sound outside softly.  Mood not affected: pleasant today.  Diving into Ezra Pound momentarily.  Need something new and stimulating to stimulate my thoughts and jolt my mind out of this creative funk.

title: Condoleeza Rice, Secretary of State
author: M
post_content: Well, that didn't take long. According to <a href="http://www.usatoday.com/news/world/2005-02-07-tomb-rice_x.htm">a USAToday stor</a>y, New Secretary of State Condoleeza Rice's motorcade passed by Yasser Arafat's tomb without stopping, continuing the Bush administration's tradition of ignoring the late Palestinian leader. Other world leaders who considered Arafat a terrorist have paid respects after his death; was it worth insulting the Palestinian people just to snub him one last time?

title: Tsunami relief
author: M
post_content: In a <a href="http://www.blogforamerica.com/archives/005781.html">blog entry</a> (how else?), former Vermont governor and presidential candidate Howard Dean has made his long-rumored candidacy for the Chairmanship of the Democratic National Committee official. Many media outlets are taking this opportunity to re-iterate that strange contradictory dichotomy: Al Gore was "lifeless" and "wooden", John Kerry was "distant" and "boring", and Howard Dean--the originator of The Scream--is "nuts". If you're going to be screwed either way, we say it's better to go down fighting for the cause than to abandon it and imitate the Republicans for votes. Sometimes a good scream can do wonders . . .

title: a tip to avert boredom
author: Magnolia
post_content: I was driving into work today traveling west, and took a turn north onto the street leading to work. As I made my turn north, I noticed a car facing south, and the woman in the driver seat was sticking her middle finger up at me. She was looking right at me, and I lipread her yelling A#*hole.  I made my turn, and parked on the side of the road (because we don't have an employee parking lot...)and thought, 'huh, what a psycho.' It dawned on me about a block into my walk to work (I had to park 3.5 blocks away because the city street cleaning is today and tomorrow, so there is no parking on the street where I work) that I didn't have my turn signal on. That's why she freaked out. But, in my defense I was all the way over to the farthest side of the street (where cars park) and approached the corner where I turned slowly. So, it's not like I did a Speedracer maneuver and cut her off at the last minute. What a psycho. When I was only a half a block away I remembered something I left in my car that I needed. So I had to turn back around and retrieve it. I was only a few feet from my car when suddenly a car stopped (screeching it's tires) and a woman's voice shouted out, "It's people like you that kill innocent people! You're an ignorant person, and a horrible driver!!!", and then she sped off. Did she double back just to say that to me? I stood dumbfounded, bewildered even. I had no choice but to shrug it off, what was I going to do? Start shouting back at no one? I got the thing I forgot out of my car, and made way back to work. A homeless man greeted me at the corner and asked me for a smoke, and when I said don't got it, he asked me for a dollar. I told him I had nothing, and he called me a crazy slut. I was about 1 block away from work, and I saw James Brown, aka "The Beast" (you know from my previous post, this is my co-worker who wears James Brown style wigs, and I LOATHE HER.) <br />So I see James Brown, and I thought to myself, "This is a perfect way to top off a crappy start." I looked over to her and smiled politely. She started to yell something over to me. "What's that?"  I said, as I could barely hear her. "I say-ed, you best not be parked in the parking lot! Someone took my spot!" (time-out, she technically doesn't have one of the coveted reserved spots in our tiny agency van only parking lot, she took one and bullies everyone into letting her keep it.) <br />"No..." I started to say, and the most miraculous thing happened. She started marching towards me, and walked right through the biggest pile of dog crap ever, in sandals even. Oh it was beautiful, first the disgusting act, then the horrified reaction, then me walking away smiling for the first time today. <br />She shouted something out to me, but I couldn't really make it out, and I didn't care to. Sometimes you just gotta let it go...

title: Bringing down the beast
author: Magnolia
post_content: Around here you hear a lot about needing Jesus, this and that. The clients we serve are often coming from a pretty dark place, and are struggling to find their purpose while getting over traumatic experiences. We are not a Christian organization or an organization that has anything to do with religion, but ironically we're heavily funded by Jewish organizations. However, we do have Christian staffers who offer words of Holy kindness when in doubt. We once had a staffer that would say to the clients, "you need Jesus" whenever the client was acting out their aggression towards the counselors. The other day, I was walking through the hallway, and one of the younger clients called out to me for help. I stopped back to her doorway to find her stuggling with a messy mop of hair. She explained to me that she couldn't get it <br />(her hair) to lie flat, and that she was doomed to be ugly. I went to her assistance combing it this way and that, trying to find a part that would work. After about 10 minutes of my struggling to get control of the situation the client broke the frustration by sighing loudly and saying, "Maggie, it's no use. My hair needs Jesus." Just when you think they never listen...<br /><br />Well, 4 more days until the election. I really can't wait for it all to be over. Personally, I don't stand strong behind either candidate. I'm quite angry with the Democratic Party for endorsing Kerry as their candidate. I was in favor of a few other options. Oh well, too late to bitch now. All we can do is sit back and hope either way, it doesn't get worse. At this point we are waist deep in a pile of crap, and I have a good feeling that under either man's watch we'll sink up to our necks before we shovel our way out. Anyone who has traveled overseas in the past four years (especially post-Iraqi invasion) knows the lowly viewpoint the rest of the world has of us. We look more greedy and more wasteful then ever. But we're safer, safer, safer. If we are so safe, why do we need to be reminded all the time?<br />I think from this point on until November 2nd, I will study my voter's guide (so many proposals in California) and try to figure out how to vote for what. My bid on the next President is already spoken for, unfortunately I'm not happy about it.

title: Round One...
author: Johnny
post_content: So I decided to start myself a blog, and while I search through a list of possible motivations to do so... I still have yet to find one worth settling on.  Considering that most of the people I associate with on a day to day basis care little for what I have to say... my audience is more or less confined to a few of my AIM buddies clicking on the link for my blog by accident and maybe my mom checking up to make sure I haven't taken up smoking crack.  But for those that do care, I'll do my best to provide you with enough quality assesments of the things I'm exposed to that you can can comfortably form the opinion you so desperately want to have of me.

title: Dentions, Saturday Schools
author: Venchinzo
post_content: <a href='http://photos1.blogger.com/img/76/933/640/small%20halo%20pic.jpg'><img border='0' style='border:1px solid #000000; margin:2px' src='http://photos1.blogger.com/img/76/933/320/small%20halo%20pic.jpg'></a><br />Okay don't read this post if you don't want to here the end....<br />What the fuck just happened?  She gets the index and there's Master Chief riding off to Earth in that Covenant battleship, and it ends?  IT ENDS?  What is the point of making a second one (story line wise) that has the same plot as its first?  You have to stop the Covenant from activating Halo like in the first Halo, so what's the point of making a second game (again story line wise) if it ends nowhere advancing the story line.  He's no more closer to the end. <br />If you stay to watch the end of the credits, there was a cut scene that showed that weird ass monster of that planet talk to CORTANA BECAUSE MASTER CHIEF LEFT HER THERE!  Who is stupid enogh to leave the Artificial Intelligence of a UNSCC  Naval Battleship on an alien planet?  Don't you think that there might be a chance that they may want to copy your weapon's developement or shield regenerators (though I don't think it matters, because if you notice how good that "mohawk" guy's works).  It's just the princibality that the end of the game really didn't END the game.  We're just gonna have to wait for another one, two years from now...

title: Abuse of Power
author: Tina
post_content: In this Blog entry I am going to discuss the Rolling Meadows case, mentioned in our book. I do believe that John Waverly did perform unethically. As a CEO he should be more professional and not involve his personal prefaces into his work life. Since John is a married man, his motive portrays to be even more unethical. The sexual harassment in this case occurred when the postgraduate was not offered a job. John focused on his attraction to her rather that on a job opportunity. The postgraduate had every right to believe that this was a sexual harassment issue and the proper board members needed to be notified. If a physical relationship had already developed prior to the confrontation, then I feel that it would not be a sexual harassment case. In this situation there was no physical relationship, just a strong work friendly partnership. John violated the Code Of Ethics and he has to face the consequences. Overall, sexual harassment is a major violation and can come in different forms. These forms include physical, verbal, and emotional. John's verbal discussion of his attraction to the postgraduate, to me falls in to the category of sexual harassment.

title: Downsizing
author: Tina
post_content: My name is Tina. I am a graduate student at UCF. I am also a Registered Nurse. I am currently working at a Cardiovascular Center in Orlando. Ethics has a valuable role in nursing. Throughout my career I have encountered many ethical decisions. My Blog will consist of my experience in the health care setting. I will also discuss my viewpoints on the many ethical dilemma we face today. These topics include sexual harassment, employee virtues, breach of confidentiality, staffing stortages, patient's rights and discrimination. In each blog I will discuss these topics, feel free to post your opinions......

title: The Official Lair
author: Super_Fawn
post_content: This last month or so has been beyond insane.  Even for me.  So I'm back with a new format (got way too sick of looking at those stupid dots, time for a change) with some updates.<br /><br />By the by, I did bomb my Chemistry final.  I wound up with a C for my final grade, which sucks, but it could have been a lot worse.  I'll do better this semester.<br /><br />I'm hosting for Homework Helpline on Thursdays now, still tutoring on Tuesdays.  It's fun, and all of it has really piqued my interest in broadcasting.  I just wish I could work more.  We only have shows three days a week, so there's really no opportunity for expansion, so I guess I'll just have to deal. <br /><br />Nathan, good to see you at Knowledge Bowl.  Sorry I was so spastic, I didn't even think to ask how your sister's team did.  It was the end of a very long week and a stressful morning.  I hope she did better than we did--we missed the wild card spot by like a point. <br /><br />I'm pretty pumped right now because I just got an email from Guvna Joe and I got the position I was hoping for in the Governor's Cabinet--Criminal Justice & Sentencing committee supervisor and Press Relations Secretary.  Very excited.  :)  This is going to be fun.<br /><br />Don't want to have an insanely long post, so until next time.

title: Purpose and Creation .1
author: Terry
post_content: Does the Creation that we sense require a Purpose?<br /><br />Is it possible that we can ever prove (or<br />demonstrate) that our Universe is such that the<br />creatures inhabiting it do (or don't) have the<br />ultimate capacity to discover the Purpose, if it<br />exists?<br /><br />Could the Purpose be circular?<br /><br />Could the Purpose be trivial?<br /><br />Could the Purpose be merely a link in a much larger<br />chain of Purpose?<br /><br />Will our scientific findings on the nano- or pico-scale,<br />and on the macro, universal-scale, lead us to a provable<br />theory of Purpose?     Or never so...<br /><br />Will our advances in science ever enable us to prove<br />or disprove the basis of Earth-bound religions?

post_content: hrmz.. you know.. i do find it a lil' weird.. not just a lil'.. but kinda a lot.. k.. people.. first month.. it's like.. a sign.. a mark.. but what did it mean to you? do you even remember when it was one month? if you don't remember.. let me remind you.. november 2nd... sighz.. i think i'm a failure... why do i always find guys that don't seem to care.. denny was like that.. until we broke up.. and he went with carmen.. then he turned into a complete different guy.... then with you.. frankie.. gawd.. i don't even know what it was that you were really after... it just.. really bothers me.. even now.. especially now.. i think about things.. and holee fuck.. if we were still together.. rite now would have made it...seven months? sighz.. i dotn' know what to say.. i jsut wanna cry now

title: The Great Caliphate
author: The Patriot
post_content: This war is what the Jihadists themselves are calling the &#8220; Third Great Jihad&#8221; and are doing so within the framework of a time line which reaches back to the very creation of Islam in the Seventh century and their attempts to recreate the dynamics which gave rise to the religion in the first two hundred years of its existence.<br /><br />No religion in history grew as fast, in its infancy, than did Islam and the reasons for this growth are not hard to explain when you understand what the world was like at the time of Muhammad&rsquo;s death in 632 AD. The Western Roman Empire was in ruins and the Eastern Empire was based in Constantinople and trying desperately to keep the power of its early grandeur while transitioning to Christianity as a de facto state religion. The costs to the average person were unbearable as he was being required to meet the constantly rising taxes levied from the state along with the tithes coerced by the Church. What Islam offered was the &#8220;carrot or the sword&#8221;.<br /><br />If you became a convert, your taxes were immediately eliminated, as was your tithe. If you didn&rsquo;t, you faced death. The choice was not hard for most to make, unless you were a very devoted martyr in the making. At the beginning, even the theology was not too hard for most to swallow, considering that both Judaism and Christianity were given their due by the Prophet. There is but one God-Allah, and Muhammad is His Prophet, as was Jesus, and the pre-Christian Jewish prophets of the Torah (old testament). Both were called &#8220;children of the book&#8221;, the book being the Koran, which replaced both the Old and New testaments for Christians and Jews.<br /><br />With this practical approach to spreading the &#8220;word&#8221; Islam grew like wild fire, reaching out from the Saudi Arabian Peninsula in all directions. This early growth is what the Muslims call the &#8220;first&#8221; great Jihad and it met with little resistance until Charles Martel of France, the father of Charlemagne, stopped them in the battle of Tours in France, after they had firmly established the religion on the Iberian peninsula. This first onslaught against the West continued in various forms and at various times until Islam was finally driven out of Spain in 1492 at the battle of Granada. <br /><br />The &#8220;second great jihad&#8221; came with the Ottoman Turks. This empire succeeded in bringing about the downfall of Constantinople as a Christian stronghold and an end to Roman hegemony in all of its forms. The Ottoman Empire was Islam&rsquo;s most successful expansion of territory even though the religion itself had fractured into warring sects and bitter rivalries with each claiming the ultimate truths in &#8220;the ways of the Prophet&#8221;. By 1683 the Ottomans had suffered a series of defeats on both land and sea and the final and failed attempt to capture Vienna set the stage for the collapse of any further territorial ambitions and Islam shrunk into various sheikhdoms, emir dominated principalities, and roving tribes of nomads. However, by this time a growing anti-western sentiment, blaming its internal failures on anyone but themselves, was taking hold and setting the stage for a new revival know has Wahhabism which came into full bloom under the House of Saud on the Arabian peninsula shortly before the onset of WWI. It is this Wahhabi version of Islam which has infected the religion itself, now finding adherents in almost all branches and sects, especially the Shiites. What this sect calls for is the complete and total rejection of anything and everything which is not based in the original teachings of The Prophet and it finds its most glaring practice in the policies of the Afgani Taliban or the Shiite practices of the late Ayatollah Khomeini in Iran. Its Ali Pasha (Field Marshall) is now known as Osama bin Laden, the leader of the &#8220;third Jihad&#8221;.<br /><br /><b>Jimmy Carter sets the stage<br /></b><br />The strategy for this &#8220;holy war&#8221; did not begin with the planning of the destruction of the World Trade Center. It began with the plans for toppling the Shah of Iran back in the early 1970&rsquo;s and culminated with his exile in 1979. With his plans and programs to &#8220;westernize&#8221; his country, along with his close ties to the U.S. and subdued acceptance of the State of Israel, the Shah was the soft target.<br /><br />Thanks, in large part to the hypocritical and disastrous policies of the Jimmy Carter State Department the revolution was set into motion, the Shah was deposed, his arm forces scattered or murdered and stage one was complete. The Third Jihad now had a base of operations and the oil wealth to support its grand design or what they call the &#8220;Great Caliphate&#8221;.<br /><br /><b>The Great Caliphate<br /></b><br />What this design calls for is the replacement of all secular leadership in any country with Muslim majorities. This would include, Egypt, Turkey, Pakistan, Indonesia, all the Emirates, Sudan, Tunisia, Libya, Algeria, Morocco, Yemen, Syria, Lebanon, Jordan and finally what they call the &#8220;occupied territory&#8221; Israel.<br /><br />As a part of this strategy, forces of the jihad will infiltrate governments and the military as a prelude to taking control, once the secular leadership is ousted or assassinated. Such was the case in Lebanon leading to the Syrian occupation and what was attempted in Egypt with the murder of Anwar Sadat, along with the multiple attempts on the lives of Hussein in Jordan, Mubarak of Egypt and Musharraf in Pakistan. Pakistan is a particular prize because of its nuclear weapons.<br /><br />The long-range strategy of the Third Jihad counts on three strategic goals. 1. The U.S. withdrawing from the region just as it did in Southeast Asia, following Vietnam. 2. Taking control of the oil wealth in the Muslim countries, which would be upwards to 75% of known reserves, and 3. Using nuclear weapons or other WMDs to annihilate Israel. A further outcome of successfully achieving these objectives would be to place the United Nations as the sole arbiter in East/West negotiations.<br /><br />Evidence of the Bush Administration awareness of this plan is found in the facts that immediately following the 9/11 attack, their first move was to shore up Pakistan and Egypt, believing that these two would be the next targets for al Qaeda while Americans focused on the disaster in New York. The administration also knew that the most important objective was to send a loud and clear message that the U.S. was in the region to stay, not only to shore up our allies but to send a message to the Jihadists. The attack on Afghanistan was necessary to break-up a secure al Qaeda base of operations and put their leadership on the run or in prison. <br /><br /><br /><b>Why Iraq?<br /><br /></b>The war on Iraq also met a very strategic necessity in that no one knew how much collaboration existed between Saddam Hussein and the master planners of the Third Jihad or his willingness to hand off WMDs to terrorist groups including the PLO in Israel. What was known, were serious indications of on-going collaboration, as Saddam funneled money to families of suicide bombers attacking the Israelis and others in Kuwait.<br /><br />What the U.S. needed to establish was a significant base of operations smack dab in the middle of the Islamic world, in a location which effectively cut it in half. Iraq was the ideal target for this and a host of other strategic reasons.<br /><br />Leadership of various anti-American groups both here and abroad understood the vital nature of the Bush initiative and thus launched their demonstrations, world-wide, to &#8220;Stop The War&#8221;. Failing this, they also laid plans to build a political campaign inside the country, with the War in Iraq as a plebiscite, using a little know politician as the thrust point; Howard Dean. This helps to explain how quickly the Radical Left moved into the Dean campaign with both people and money, creating what the clueless media called the &#8220;Dean Phenomenon&#8221;. <br /><br />By building on the left-wing base in the Democrat party and the &#8220;Hate Bush&#8221; liberals, the campaign has already resulted in a consensus among the aspirants, minus Joe Lieberman, to withdraw the U.S. from Iraq and turn the operation over to the U.N. And, if past is prologue, i.e. Vietnam, once the U.S. leaves it will not go back under any circumstances, possibly even the destruction of Israel.<br /><br />Should George W. Bush be defeated in November and a new administration come to power we could expect to see the dominoes start to fall in the secular Islamic countries and The Clash of Civilizations would then become a life changing event in all of our lives.<br /><br />What surprised the Jihadists following the 9/11 attack was how American sentiment mobilized around the president and a profound sense of patriotism spread across the country They were not expecting this reaction, based on what had happened in the past, nor were they expecting the determined resolve of the President himself. I believe that this is one of the reasons we have not had any further attacks within our borders. They are content to wait, just as one of their tactical mentors, V.I. Lenin admonished&#8230;&#8221;two steps forward, one step back&#8221;.<br /><br />A couple of additional events serve as valuable footnotes to the current circumstances we face: the destruction of the human assets factor of the CIA during the Carter presidency, presided over by the late Senator Frank Church and Carter&rsquo;s CIA Director, Admiral Stansfield Turner. This fact has plagued our intelligence agencies right up to this very day with consequences which are now obvious. Jimmy Carter is the one man who must bear the bulk of the responsibility for setting the stage of the Third Jihad. Americans should find little comfort in how the Democrat contenders constantly seek the &#8220;advice and counsel&#8221; of this despicable little hypocrite who now prances around with his Nobel Prize, while attacking President Bush with almost as much venom as his fellow Nobel Laureate, Yassir Arafat.<br /><br /><b>We should not expect to see any meaningful cooperation from Western Europe, especially the French.</b><br /><br />Since failing to protect their own interests in Algeria by turning the country over to the first of the Arab terrorists, Amid Ben Bella, the country itself is now occupied by Islamic immigrants totally twenty percent of the population. <br />We are in the battle of our lives which will go on for many years possibly even generations. If we fail to understand what we are facing or falter in the challenge of &#8220;knowing our enemy&#8221; the results will be catastrophic. <br /><br /><b>PART II (May 1, 2004) <br /></b><br />Since writing the above, we have witnessed some frightening evidence in support of our hypothesis both internally and in other parts of the world.<br /><br />The al Qaeda bombing in Madrid has emboldened our enemy into believing it can use terror as an instrument for democratic regime change. Based on what happened there, they may be right.<br /><br /><b>Kerry and bin Laden on the same page</b> <br /><br />John Kerry and other leaders of his party constantly refer to the United States as &#8220;acting unilaterally.&#8221; They give no credit whatsoever to countries like Great Britain, Poland, Italy, Australia or even tiny Honduras for putting their limited armed forces in harm&rsquo;s way to support the U.S. led coalition in Iraq. It is little wonder that some are considering doing what Spain has done&#8212;pulling out. The leaders in these countries have spent considerable political capital in this effort, and have little to show for it as it relates to fostering good will with the American public. Couple that fact with Osama bin Ladin&rsquo;s latest offer of withholding attacks on those who &#8220;quit&#8221; the coalition and you have all the elements for a Democrat party fostered &#8220;self-fulfilling prophecy&#8221; where the U.S. will be totally alone in the pacification of Iraq. John Kerry and the Bush critics persist in the &#8220;lie&#8221; of the U.S. going it &#8220;alone&#8221; in Iraq but Osama bin Laden knows differently and will use the Kerry rhetoric to help isolate the U.S. The terrorists now see themselves as political &#8220;king-makers&#8221;. They may be right.<br /><br />Another aspect of the &#8220;anti-Bush&#8221; political axis is how both his political enemies and the main stream media take ghoulish delight in &#8220;the body count,&#8221; just as they did in the later days of Vietnam. Oh sure, they pay incidental homage to the memory of the young Americans who gave their lives in the greatest threat this country has ever faced, but they do so with all the sincerity of Madonna making a vow of chastity. As the body bags grow in number, they believe, so grows their political prospects. They may be right.<br /><br />If the Bush administration is further weakened in the months leading up to the November elections, we will witness a heightened al Qaeda offensive in all parts of the world, including our own country, and especially in Iraq and nations surrounding it ,i.e., Pakistan, Jordan, Saudi Arabia and Egypt. Events within the past few days in Jordan not only make this argument but also point to the possibility of &#8220;what happened to the WMDs.&#8221;<br />Iran and Syria are daily growing more overt and bold in their support of insurgents within Iraq, believing that Bush has been so hurt by internal politics that he is powerless to act against them in any meaningful way. They may be right.<br /><br /><b>The Leftwing initiative, Political Correctness and Our Will to Win</b><br /><br />Within our own country we are witnessing and almost insane application of &#8220;political correctness.&#8221; As the barbarism of radical Islam grows more apparent in the streets of the Middle East from Gaza to Basra, we see a cultural suicide taking place within our own schools and communities.<br /><br />Our children are being taught from the Koran, our professors are preaching intifadah in their class rooms, and Muslim &#8220;call to prayer&#8221; loud speakers are blaring out from city halls. The more precarious our very existence becomes, the more our liberal brethren embrace their enemies. It is a Stockholm Syndrome which can only lead to the recruitment of young Muslims who will be willing to duplicate in the West what their co-religionists are doing in the streets of Israel and the market places of Baghdad. The liberal P.C. crowd say nothing about the silence of the Muslim religious leadership as it relates to the carnage of innocents but couldn&rsquo;t speak out fast enough against the inspiration supplied to tens of millions of Christians by Mel Gibson&rsquo;s The Passion of the Christ. They were put off by the movie&rsquo;s &#8220;violence&#8221; and its alleged &#8220;fostering of anti-Semitism&#8221;. Movies must represent their &#8220;reality&#8221; as the real thing moves them not at all. Among liberal Jews in America, hatred of George W. Bush is only surpassed by their contempt for Ariel Sharon&#8230;Let them explain it, I am at a total loss to do so. Maybe they just miss seeing Bill Clinton smooching Yassir Arafat in the White House Rose Garden. <br /><br />The &#8220;Reverend&#8221; Jesse Jackson is now calling the U.S. &#8220;guilty of crimes against humanity&#8221; as he sets out to mobilize the non-Islamic Left. None of the Democrat leadership says a word in opposition to Jackson&rsquo;s treason or Hillary&rsquo;s attacks on the President and U.S. policy in an Arabic newspaper, while in London. You can bet that al Jezeera didn&rsquo;t miss a beat in their reporting of both events.<br /><br /><b>The campaign takes its toll</b><br /><br />The campaign is seriously hurting Mr. Bush&rsquo;s leadership role in the War on Terror. While ducking every new book critical of his initiative or trying to counter the partisan nitpicking of the 9/11 Commission, he has persisted in the misbegotten insistence of &#8220;installing democracy&#8221; in Iraq. Our purpose for being in that beleaguered country should be restricted to one purpose and one purpose only, to stop the expansion of The Third Jihad and provide a base for doing same in the neighboring areas. This can be done by sealing the borders, attacking anything that moves in violation of same and by making it clear to Syria and Iran that any participation on their part will be considered an &#8220;act of war&#8221;. Let the country be governed by the local tribes, Shiite in the south, Sunni in the central and Kurds in the north with a U.S. pro consul overseeing the military. Oil revenues could be spilt by population allocation. How about installing a Republic&#8230;it worked pretty well here with diverse populations.<br /><br />The very idea that we should spend our sons and daughters blood or our tax dollars on trying to building a &#8220;democracy&#8221; in the region which has neither a history nor a desire for such, is sheer nonsense. The very essence of Islamic teaching speaks directly against this principle. Continuing on the current path can only result in fostering greater hatred for the &#8220;Great Satan&#8221;. Force is the only thing which is respected in that part of the world and this force need not be tied to &#8220;reform&#8221;. I suggest Mr. Rumsfled acquaint himself with a copy of Julius Caesar&rsquo;s Gallic Wars and Sun Tsu&rsquo;s Art of War. All the tactics and strategies necessary to subdue the Iraqi insurgents can be found in those two military gems.<br /><br /><b>Please not the UN</b><br /><br />Bringing the U.N. to the party will only compound the problem without adding any accountability. The U.N. has been accused of many things over the years, but being a &#8220;democratic&#8221; institution has never been one of them. Just the latest scandal of the &#8220;Oil for Food&#8221; program should provide any thinking person with all the evidence they need to keep the U.N. at bay. But this doesn&rsquo;t seem to bother the likes of the John Kerry&rsquo;s of the world who prattle on as if the scam doesn&rsquo;t even exist.<br /><br />Just one example will make my case; the UN mandate in Israel, which has been in place since 1948. One more salient point needs to be made on this subject. There is no such thing as &#8220;The International Community.&#8221; There are only individual countries, each with its own agenda which is always self serving. The myth of a higher level of &#8220;moral authority&#8221; coming out of the UN as been one of the greater lies of the past half century, but it is a lie which persists in spite of a bloody record of hypocrisy, graft, genocide and &#8220;perpetual war for perpetual peace.&#8221; I have a suggestion for the 9/11 Commission:.Why don&rsquo;t they look into what the UN was doing before the attack on the World Trade Center? If they do, they will find that exactly one week before, the UN was holding a Conference on Racism in Durbin, South Africa where the delegates voted overwhelmingly to condemn Israel, as &#8220;racist and terrorist.&#8221; The U.S., Canadian and Israeli delegates walked out in disgust. Nary a word was uttered about Saddam Hussein, al Qaeda, or the Taliban, to say nothing of what was happening in Rwanda while they crunched caviar on toast and washed it down with vintage Champaign. Genocide does not qualify as &#8220;racism&#8221; according to the UN &#8220;morality.&#8221; Neither we nor the world needs the UN to muck up what is already a very delicate situation. If given proper leadership every Middle Eastern country named above will throw in with the Coalition, for if they don&rsquo;t they will be the next targets of the Third Great Jihad and the Great Caliphate. Pakistan is already showing the leadership which others will follow. What do you think moved Kadahaffi to cozy up to the U.S. and Great Britain? He fears the Jihadist more than he hates us.<br /><br /><b>Evil Does Exist</b><br /><br />Our current crises, in meeting the threat of the Third Jihad, is one more example of how most Americans simply refuse to believe there is evil in this world and are willing to grant moral equivalence on any human action. Unless the crime is personalized such as in the case of Lacy Peterson, we lose interest quickly and become bored or at least not involved.<br /><br />To try and understand what we are facing, look into the eyes of your son or grandson and try to fathom a mind which would take pride in strapping a bomb to his body and sending him out to kill himself and countless innocent people. Or in the case of your daughter or grand daughter, try to imagine a religion which commands you to mutilate her vagina to destroy her sex drive or demands you to stone her to death if she has sexual relations with a man other than of your choosing.<br /><br />If you can comprehend these facts both intellectually and emotionally, then you will start to understand what we are facing in the months and years ahead, both at home and abroad. <br /><br />The radicals of Islam will stop at nothing to destroy us and all we stand for. They see this war as their &#8220;entry to paradise&#8221; and a release from the miserable existence they have built for themselves within the confines of an evil and perverse religion. The Jihadist are NOT like us, nor most of their fellow Muslims. But, like terrorists everywhere they have silenced any criticisms from fellow Muslims through threat and intimidation and have, with the help of the &lsquo;useful idiots&#8221; in the West, &#8220;created the appearance of popular support&#8221;.<br /><br />If we are incapable of understanding these realities and acting accordingly, within the life time of everyone who reads these words, we will see our cherished way of like cease to exist and chaos become our lot. The Clash of Civilizations is now reaching out and touching all of us. May God grant us the wisdom and the courage to meet the challenge.<br /><br /><div align="center"><b><a href="http://www.patriotsunite.com" title="Patriots Unite" target="_blank">Patriots Unite</a></b></div>

title: FSU oil shock model
author: @whut
post_content: I took a shot at fitting the Former Soviet Union (FSU) oil production data using the <a href="http://mobjectivist.blogspot.com/2005/10/oil-depletion-model-posts.html">oil shock model</a>. This graph from <span style="font-weight:bold;">peakoil.net</span> shows the discovery data superimposed on to the production data.<br /><img src="http://www.peakoil.net/uhdsg/weo2004/FSU.jpg" width="420"/><br />I transcribed the data from the chart (ignoring the extrapolated data) and used the general model source code.<br /><img src="http://img335.imageshack.us/img335/8573/fsuprod1tr.gif"/><br />I used a mean value of 5 years for each of the <i>fallow</i>, <i>build</i>, and <i>maturation</i> phases. This came out shorter than the 8 year latencies that I chose for the <a href="http://mobjectivist.blogspot.com/2005/10/shock-model-with-aspo-discovery-data.html">global</a> and <a href="http://mobjectivist.blogspot.com/2005/10/shock-model-applied-to-usa-lower-48.html">USA-48</a> model. <br /><br />The green curve assumes a proportional extraction rate of 0.09/year (<i>1/e</i> time of about 11 years).  This follows the production curve up until about the time of political instability in the Soviet Union. After that point, c.1984, I added perturbations according to the following chart, leading to the red curve which overlays the production data points.<br /><img src="http://img335.imageshack.us/img335/5779/fsuperturb9pw.gif"/><br /><a href="http://mobjectivist.blogspot.com/2005/10/hubbert-did-in-soviet-union.html"></a><br />The glitch occurring after 1984 looks benign but evidently carried some punch -- according to some interesting remarks I found previously, Reagan had a hand in it:<a href="http://mobjectivist.blogspot.com/2005/10/hubbert-did-in-soviet-union.html"><blockquote>It seems likely that the Reagan administration, which took office in 1981, bearing in mind the economic havoc produced when US production peaked in 1981, followed by the Arab oil embargo and the "oil crisis" of 1973-74 and the deep recession that followed, decided to use the "oil weapon" to destabilize the USSR. Reagan embarked on a major military buildup, putting the Soviet Union under pressure to keep up. Meanwhile, declining prices after 1981 forced the USSR to pump more oil to supply its clients in Eastern Europe and to sell in world markets for hard currency. Then in 1985 Reagan persuaded Saudi Arabia to flood the world markets with cheap oil. Again, the USSR had to increase output to earn hard currency. This led to the second peak in 1988.</blockquote></a> I see a more of a dip followed by a recovery rather than a strict oil production increase, which I imagine could result from a lagged reaction to market forces. The Soviets had no choice but to shut down their pumps temporarily -- they did not have the technology or reserves to increase production beyond what the big red Soviet machine could already provide. By the time 1988 arrived, it became too late for them to do anything about it, as the eastern bloc started to implode.<br /><br />The post-Soviet transition shows a severe reduction in extraction rates. Clearly, the new FSU republics no longer had to produce oil to continue militarizing their bloc countries and allies (including Cuba). True free-market forces replaced the fixed demand and the new capitalists also had their eye on the green curve (peak oil in 1990). Much like the USA after our peak in 1970, they likely wanted to modulate the supply.<br /><br />So what explains the reverse shock (i.e. sudden extraction increase) in the last few years? Note that the BP data also <a href="http://mobjectivist.blogspot.com/2005/10/mind-is-terrible-thing-to-decline.html">shows this FSU oil production increase</a>. I don't know why, but OPEC production hasn't really gone up much over the past few years, and the FSU clearly has, or at least had the production capacity during the Soviet era. I would imagine that <span style="font-style:italic;">somebody</span> has to make up the potentially widening supply & demand gap.  <br /><br />The model shows that at the current proportional extraction rate, the FSU has probably hit its secondary oil peak. They can conceivably try to keep on increasing the extraction rate (seeing as they do have that Soviet-era spare capacity, <span style="font-style:italic;">unless, of course,</span> it all got sold by Russian scrap-iron merchants in the ensuing years).  But remember, the law of extraction: the steeper the hill, the faster the decline post-peak.<br /><br />Thanks to <a href="http://peakenergy.blogspot.com/2005/10/peak-sightings.html#comments">Big Gav</a> to get me motivated to work on this analysis.<br /><br /><hr width="70%"/><br /><span style="font-style:italic;">"I pledge not to go to war for oil"</span> -- Jimmy Smits, fictional presidential candidate on the TV show, <span style="font-weight:bold;">West Wing</span>.<br /><br />Interesting live presentation of the show.<br /><br />Funny how it takes a fictional debate to bring a good discussion of energy issues to the American prime-time audience.

title: post
author: Ticker
post_content: <p>Hector looked out of the window and saw the forest floor stretch out beneath<br />him. Ramon's attic overlooked a vast carpet of trees which he could espy through<br />a telescope (ordered through Amazon) and it was all quiet. But over by a clump<br />of bushes near a hill, Hector thought he could see two red pinpoints of light<br />gleaming in the dark space between the vegetation.</p><br /><p>&quot;Dad&quot;, he said, &quot;let's go out and wander in the woods!&quot;.</p><br /><p>&quot;No&quot;, Ramon said, &quot;that would be a <b>bad</b> idea.&quot;</p><br /><p>&quot;Come on, Dad, I think it would be <i>exciting</i>.&quot;</p><br /><p>&quot;You mean it would be dumb.&quot;</p><br /><p>&quot;Exciting is when something unusual happens to you.&quot;</p><br /><p>&quot;I'll bet you see something unusual in the woods!&quot; said Ramon.</p><br /><p>&quot;Only two lousy pinpoints of red light&quot;, said Hector.</p><br /><p>&quot;Those are eyes. Monster eyes&quot;, said Ramon.</p><br /><p>&quot;Uh ... oh!&quot;, mumbled Hector in a disappointed way.</p><br /><p>Hector went back to his room and thought: 'how can I help Dad?' Then he had<br />an idea. When Ramon was asleep, he would creep out of his room and start the<br />elevator which ran from the bottom of his tree house to the top so that anyone<br />on the forest floor could come up and visit! That would <i>really help</i> dad.</p><br /><p>Meanwhile, down in the jungle, a horrible monster steadily advanced on<br />Ramon's tree house. It was a great, slimy beast, with two red glowing eyes, a<br />set of razor-sharp fangs and claws plus an insatiable appetite for eating little<br />boys. (It also had cruel talons). But when it got to the base of the mighty<br />tree, on which Ramon's tree house was perched too far above him to reach, he<br />could go no further.</p><br /><p>Just then the light above the elevator on the ground floor was illuminated.<br />The door whisked open and the monster found he could enter the elevator leading<br />to the top floor -- and a meal of little boy.</p>

title: Unisured:ethical issue
author: Michelle D
post_content: Frankie Perry, the author of The Tracks We Leave –Ethics in Healthcare Management, shows healthcare managers serious ethical issues they will have to face. As I read chapter one-Medical Errors: Paradise Hills medical center, it paints a clear picture of how many leaders do not fully understand how easily a code of ethics can be broken. The leadership (governing board and CEO of paradise Hills) did not see how unethical it was to withhold information from there patients. They had much reason behind the unethical behavior (upkeep of reputation, financial loss, potential law suits), however none was worthy of it. Every healthcare organization will make mistakes; that is not unethical. How the mistake is “handled” can become very unethical.
